Now, I've read the Wired articles.  I've seen photos that people I know 
have taken from previous years.  I've seen video.  I've heard stories.  
I've seen drawings of self-propelled couches and relaxing hot springs and 
eateries named after hell.  

My conclusion:  Burning Man is not a rave.  It seems to me to be a chance 
for people to just become completely distracted from whatever hangups 
they have and go out into nowheresville and light stuff on fire.

Sounds like a blast!  Doesn't sound like a rave.

Maybe the Burning Man posts should have a NRR tag on them.

So Mr. E has decided to make this a quiet evening after all... Save myself
for a Sunset tomorrow or Spundae's tomorrow night.

Anyways, I'd thought I post to the list tonight.

About three years ago this very month, I introduced a friend in my high
school to the SF scene.  About this time marks the anniversary of me doing
so, and I wonder to this day how he is doing.  He was from Ukraine, and I
was one in the group of friends to befriend him and ask if he wanted to go
out and dance at a party that weekend.

I never thought I'd be one of those introducing someone to the Sf
underground culture, but if it was meant to be, so it was....

He had told me of his experiences in Ukraine w/ the dance clubs there, and
to me, it made no difference at all.  We were there to dance, have a good
evening, and to share our common vibe.

I'd like to say more, but I guess I'm just trying to start a new thread n'
stuff.  

I'd like to hear some of your guys' stories about introducing someone new
to the scene n' stuff.

I still remember vividly at graduation his final words to me, b4 I last saw
him and b4 his plane trip back to the Ukraine, "I can say I've been to a
rave in the Ukraine, Richmond, and San Francisco!"

Goodnight everyone in San Francisco! Be proud and be strong for our city's
strength and scene! :-}
Mr. E

Subject: early warmth review

Precedence: bulk

i should be packing right now, but i thought i'd write a quick note about
the wonderfulness that was warmth, maybe i'll be the first (i'm on digest
so i'm not sure...) but...

it's only 4:23, and warmth is still going strong...why am i home then?
well, as i was getting ready to head out, my dad calls and unfortunately,
my grandfather had passed away.  i was prepared for this, and i believe
after a full life, he was ready.  i had to book an emergency flight home to
boston tomorrow morning. i almost didn't go to the party because i would
only be able to stay for less than the amount of time it would take me to
drive there and back (from sacto), but i just got in the car and started
driving before rationalization took over.

let me just say that i am soooooooooooooooooo glad i went.  i had to tear
myself away to leave.  this was a second to none gathering of people
celebrating life, living it to its fullest.  i was definitely absorping a
lot of the love that was in the air.  i think that when faced with a loss
of a loved one, you must reflect on the wonderful things he or she brought
to the world and then you must celebrate the life you are living, and
that's definitely what i was doing tonight.

much thanks and hugs to all the wonderful people i met - esp. beth, jenny,
b))merang, nancy, orson, and rich.

julie, seth, and alex, i looked for you, but couldn't find you, oh well,
next time!

love,
/scott

YES!!!!!!!!! Warmth was such a totally PHAT PARTY!  Thank you, thank you,
thank you to Spencer for organizing it, thanx to everyone who worked so
hard to make last night one of the best yet.  With the exception of the
loss of music @^(, and my difficulties with popping my balloon hat with my
cigarette (more than once!) the visuals (Silicon Graphics Indy WoW!)
decorations, and overall the vibe were absolutley splendiferous and made
for a really fun party!

But it was definately the people who made it.  Never before have I partied
so joyously with such a wonderfully vibrant, loving crowd!  Thank you all!
I met yet more sfravers, hello y'all! (I'm bummed that the poor memory is
failing me on all the new names, but I know I met a bunch of new people
with laminates when I was passing the jelly bears out...... hiya!)  It was
simply an incredibly happy, loving environment and I LOVED IT!

Shame it was soooooooo hot that I couldn't dance for more than a few
minutes at a time, but Micron kept my butt wiggling longer than most -
thanx Dan!  But the music died B4 Macadio got to spin @^(  very bad, very
bad.......

Great to see Leslie there too, strange how she's always there at the _best_
parties @^)

So, all in all, a fandablious nite.  Looking forward to the next one Spence!

luvnhugz,

nick xxx

reverting to my childhood nickname for postings to the list - so look for

the Warmth CD, see Jelo or Fubari IMMEDIATELY!

]
This was a great party, Uberzone went off, his set rocked the house. 
All the dj's had great sets,  The music realy PUMPUD.  The party was
very just like the flyer, very bright, sharp, colorful and LOUD.  
2 huge sound systems, a phat lazer, and incredible multi wall visuals by
lsd and pink 6.
The setup was very thought out, and there was a lot of room to walk
around and dance.  The security was very polite, and the staff was
wonderful.  
Of course the bigest problem with that location (2nd and jackson) is the
ventalation, and that there is no outside area, so needles to say it was
a sauna inside.  They rented a bunch of fans to blow cold air in from
the streets, but there was no exuast fans runing, so the hot air all got
blown into the back of the buiding, were it must have been 20-30 degrees
hoter then in front!  But the party still totaly went off!

Big props to Global Rythm Movement, and The Demon Colective for throwing
a party with such a good vibe and great production.    
It was nice to see many familiar faces there, and meet many new people.

well it looks like its going to be a good summer for raving

keep it real
Ray Vonie

From sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com  Sun Jun  1 12:11:01 1997

Received: from localhost (matt@localhost)

Date: Sun, 1 Jun 1997 12:14:53 -0700 (PDT)
From: "Matthew D. P. K. Lanier" <matt@saturn5.com>
X-Sender: matt@atari
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: warmth review
Message-ID: <Pine.GSO.3.95.970601120212.22128A-100000@atari>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

hello all-

about every couple months or so, i start to get a little jaded with the rave scene.  i wonder, what am i doing here?  who do i like these parties? 

and then, i go to a party that makes me remember why i rave.

well, warmth really helped me remember why i love to rave.

1)the music rocked.  never before have i danced to much or enjoyed being soaked with sweat (my own and others from hugs) clear down to the bone.  i especially liked micron's set (i think that was it), for he had the crown going.  trance never sounded so g
ood.
and then there was the music in the other large room, sometimes bordering on housey, funky stuff.  a good break from the pounding of the main room.  more space, and a bit cooler, and easier to talk while dancing.
the ambient / chill room was so relaxing... i went there each time i was about to go into the main room to get my energy up, to look at all the happy little groups of ravers huddling on the floor, and then i was ready to dance again!.

2)the chai.  i have never had a chai frosty, but that was, by far, the best way to help me stay awake through a rave.  i was still going strong when i had to leave, the chai gave me energy without jitters.  go chai!!!

3)the visuals.  in the main room, very sparse.  the lasers effectively recreatedthe look of stars outside, while some single lasers mounted to the ceiling made cool patterns on the floor.  it was sparse, but beautiful.
in the funky room, i believe those visuals were done by randy.  need i say more?  it was beautiful!
in the chill room, graphics done by former co-workers of mine at sgi, so i got to play with an indigo (or an onyx, i'm not sure which they were running).  it was great to see other geeks there, tripping out on computers like i normally do.  i felt entirel
y at home.

4)the people.  i'm so happy to see more and more santa cruz people in the sf rave scene.  i think that some of the santa cruz ravers have been a wonderful shot in the arm of the sf bay area scene, infusing new energy, creativity, and love into our scene. 
 i'm going to more and more santa cruz parties, and am really happy that they're coming up to sf, also!!!

and of course, i went to the party with my friend, sarah, who makes any party fun!

so, i hope to see ya'll around soon.  i know i'll be there.  i really feel like my faith in the rave scene as a group of wonderful individuals has been restored.  THANKS WARMTH!!!

love to you all-

matt =)

To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: regular ol text copy of the proposed new welcome message to sfraves
Message-ID: <Pine.BSI.3.95.970601121647.20348D-100000@taz.hyperreal.com>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII

Precedence: bulk


My silly mailer converted the new welcome into a bunch of garbage when it
was sent - some mailers could read it but others couldn't.  Here it is in
plain text.  Again, I'd prefer comments privately and am totally open to
changing parts of it.

	Brian

*******************************************************************************
Welcome to the San Francisco Bay Area RAVE mailing list!
*******************************************************************************

Please read this completely!

SFRaves is dedicated to discussion centered on the rave / underground
club / techno scene here in the San Francisco Bay Area.  

Appropriate topics include: 

  Announcements of upcoming bay area events
  Reviews of previous events/DJ's/new records, etc
  SF-related and rave-culture-related topics, like smart drinks
  Rave-related stories on local TV stations or newspapers.
  Personal introductions/socializing, to a degree.

Things are very loose, but try and stay focused - think of this list
as consisting of people who are interested in raving in San Francisco,
but not necessarily as the only list these people are subscribed to.
There are a plethora of other mailing lists and newsgroups out there -
for example the "idm" and "ambient" mailing lists on hyperreal or
alt.music.techno on USENET.  There are also more than a dozen other
regionalized mailing lists out there for different parts of the US
and world.


ETIQUETTE

There are a bunch of general etiquette guidelines I want to make
sure you all have at least heard:

1) The list can be very high volume.  To keep it usable for as many
people as possible, and so the machine running SFRaves doesn't keel
over from too much delivery work, please try and keep your messages to
the point and not overly chatty.  If you are responding to a message,
keep the amount of quoted text as low as possible.  Try and keep your
"signature" file to less than 4 lines, too.

2) The list goes to many people, and is also archived for historical
reason; never say anything which you would not want to be seen by
someone far in the future, for example, details of personal drug
consumption, either your own or someone else's.  Though I doubt this
is the case, you should assume that law enforcement reads this list.
If you want an anonymous account, check out www.hotmail.com.

3) SFRaves is *not* a paging service, nor is it a "chat line" for
one-sentence messages.  If you want to just "chat", check out VRave,
at <telnet://hyperreal.com:7283/>.  SFRaves is also not a group
therapy support line - but thoughtful posts about how you have been
affected by rave culture are appropriate, because after all raving is
a very personal experience.

4) The occasional humorous post or not-entirely-rave-related topic is
fine, but please prefix it with the letters "NRR" in the subject line,
so people who don't want to see that can filter it out.  I.e. 

  Subject: NRR: a joke...

5) Promoting your party, your DJ gig, your new mixtape, etc. are all
fine, but please prefix the subject line with the letters "BSP", i.e.

  Subject: BSP: underground party tonight!

6) Offering things for sale are fine, so long as they are marginally
rave-related, such as musical instruments, sound systems, lighting
gear, etc.  This time, prefix it with the letters "4SALE", i.e.

  Subject: 4SALE: SL1200 turntables.

7) Normal etiquette is to wait around 2 weeks or more before you start
posting anything; that ensures that you don't tread on old ground and
that you have a reasonably good idea of the mindset of the list.

8) Posting virus alerts is usually not only unnecessary, but can be
bogus and virus-like themselves.  For information about bogus virus
alerts check out <http://www.kumite.com/myths/>.

9) Don't forward someone else's private email to the list without
their consent.  

It's all about the "R" in PLUR: RESPECT.  The fact that email is free
and instantaneous has given us a really great communication system
here - let's not blow it by abusing it.

Please bear in mind that you are entering a virtual community; that
the people here exhibit a friendliness and familiarity with each
other, and while criticism of posts is not discouraged, please treat
other people's posts with the same respect you'd want yours treated.

SFRaves is not a moderated list - everything sent to it will get
reflected out to the other 500 list members.  However, only people who
are subscribed to the list (or the digest) may send a message to it -
mostly in an effort to fight spam mail.  Since people sometimes change
email address (and sometimes it gets changed without their knowing),
messages can get caught before being reflected and forwarded to me,
the list-owner.  I'll either forward them along, or let the person
know why they didn't get forwarded.  I will not pass along caught
messages which violate the policies above.

If someone violates the policies set here to an unacceptable level,
the list-owner reserves the right to remove them from the list as a
last resort.  Being on this list is a privilege, not a right.


OTHER RESOURCES

There is an incredible wealth of information related to raving, techno
music, and alternative chemistry at Hyperreal, accessible through the
URL <http://hyperreal.com/> There should be an up-to-the-minute
calendar in there; if you have info on events that aren't listed, send
details about it to the SFRaves calendar maintainer, Derek Chung, at
dhchung@hyperreal.com.  There are also other mailing lists there.

In addition, check out the newsgroup "alt.raves" for non-SF-specific
discussion about raving.


SUBSCRIPTION INFORMATION

This is how most of you got on this list: you sent a message to
majordomo@hyperreal.com with the line

  subscribe sfraves

in it.  Cool, perfect.  Now, if you want off, you send the following
message to majordomo@hyperreal.com:

  unsubscribe sfraves

And if you just want Derek Chung's weekly calendar, you can send

  unsubscribe sfraves
  subscribe sfraves-calendar

Or, if you want to get on the "digest" version of sfraves (about 1
digest per day, depending on traffic), send this:

  unsubscribe sfraves
  subscribe sfraves-digest

If you think there is a technical problem with the list, send a
message to me at "sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com".  I will respond as
quickly as I can.

Enjoy the list!

Hi all!   ]=)

On Sun, 1 Jun 1997, Matthew D. P. K. Lanier wrote:

[snip]

>  3)the visuals. 

[snip]


> in the funky room, i believe those visuals were done by randy.  need i 
> say more?  it was beautiful!

 Wow!  :) Thanks Matt!!! I was really happy with what I achieved for 
Warmth! I feel it was the best looking, smoothest running, and best 
integrated design (with the other visual artists in the room) that I have 
ever done. Harmony 3 was really good but most of the reason was the room 
itself and so many other artists giving of themselves also.

 I really must give phat props to Spencer! So kewl and unflappable this 
man handled it all so well! Especially nice was his personal attention 
periodically throughout the night to see if I was okay and had everyting 
I needed.

 However the most respectful and heart felt thanks goes out to the kind 
folks that stayed and helped clean up and helped to haul my equipment and 
others back down the stairs. You folks are divine angels and I love you 
all!! 

 This brings me to a momentary diversion and pet peeve; all the energy 
vampires that come to help to get in free and then do nothing. You people 
suck! Almost as bad is the folks that come to help with set up but refuse 
to be there for clean-up. We need both and those that do are indeed divine.

 Party was great!! So many happy people ( a few *too* happy ;)! Hi to; 
Leslie, Patrick, Orson (thanks for the laminate! :), Ma66ie (I hope you 
get your recharger back!),Amy (at last we meet and all to briefly!), 
Matt, Terry, Mike, Jeff and ? (I'm sorry sweety! I forgot :(  ), 
Rebecca Zak and Ned, Deepfog, b((marang, Shin, Dave, Jim, Lara (your soooo 
sweet! :), Rob, and a host of thousands!

 The party was certainly one of the most beautiful (visually) and 
interesting musically that I have *ever* been to! Matt (CF) and Spencer 
(?) were spinning this wierd funky jazz shit with horns that was so 
non-standard rave material but soooo danceable. I loved it! The room I 
was in had a very ecletic feel that I loved.

 The peeps were very yummy and Ann and John were great as usual. The 
crowd was a little bit dense (numbers wise) but this wouldn't have been 
so bad if the heat and humidity hadn't been so outa hand. I like heat and 
moisture but when I start drippng sweat after 10 minutes of playing with 
the lights then that is too much. I can't work in that and put on the 
kind of quality shows that I love to do.

 Another peeve; We had to shut the individual room doors and keep folks 
in when the police arrived. So what does everyone (it seemed) do in that 
hot,stiffling, muggy atmosphere? Why light their cigarettes of course! 
And us non-smokers were trapped in there and could not escape. Very nasty 
and rude.

 The fruit handed out in the morning was well appreciated! Thanks for the 
donut Terry!

 Overall a fantastic party! A 8.95 outa 10.


hugz!


Ran D. Dreams 						    new number soon



       
                                     (Namaste)
                                         /
                                   -=*=-/
                                     ~

Shouts out to Eric (ERMODA) for pulling off such an awsome party!

The beats were bangin SO hard gotta love UBERZONE if you've never heard 
him live GO! I'd say him and Chrystal Method *(ROCK)* the most in live 
acts! 

The DJs were all on last night too, DJ saint I personally got to know (a 
real kind person, so dam down to earth too. really great uplifting music 
:)  Jazz-e too was rockin, who i later was introduced to; such a calm 
guy, wow! My only complaint would have to be the heat... but it's almost 
becoming a necesity at parties these days, like a rave wouldn't happen if 
it was too cold... dunno! But stepping one SO many water bottles gets to 
you after awhile and then having to deal with all the nutcases that 
continue to ADD to the heat waving their burning death sticks around, yuk!

Anyways, hands down... great party! So happy to have been there, thanx 
again eric! hope everyone who didn't go did have a good weekend too :)

plur, liquid

Subject: DJ Flux vs. DJ Rinse tape
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

I was pleasently surprised today when I opened my mailbox and found a copy
of the new DJ Flux vs. DJ Rinse tape.

I popped it in immediately and found some sick ass smooth jungle/d&b!!
The tape has overlays from MC Phluid which just adds to the overall impact
of the sets.  

I don't listen to a whole bunch of jungle, but I'd just like to say that
after recieving this tape and hearing it, jungle has one new fan.

Again props out to Flux and Fluid of the B.A.S.S. Kru for sending me this
tape, I highly recommend it!  



Matthew Wietzke  ---xpress@popstar.com---

Hi allzs, what'z happening? :)
I'm here, just recovering from Warmth'oritis :)

lets see, how shall I start? ;)
Hummm... Once upon a time (sat afternoon) I was supposed to go help
setup and stuff, then I feel asleep while waiting for my friends (who
where also going to help setup and who are very wonderful for offering
me a ride -Hi Amanda and Duston ;)) unfortunately, what I meant to be
a 10min 'nap ended up becoming a 4 hour deep sleep! :( so I woke up at
around 8:45pm then noticed, my ride wasn't there :) oops! 
Anyhow,

Got to the party, and said Hi to lots of peoples :) Hi lots of peoples!
:) much love [*HUGSHUGSHUGS*] ( I would start saying names, but I don't
want to leave anyone out :( ) la la la..the party is going on, then SAM
starts to spin...WOW! I loved it :) it was hella nice :) so I danced a
bit (I usually don't dance! so its a good sign ;P) went into the chill
room for a bit and BoomerangFidget was spinin'...(I think he was?) he
played some GrateFullDead, and ambienty stuff. it was chillin' :) hehe.

then I started feelin' kinda sick :( so I was in a weird mood after
that. I think it was the heat :( the party was definitely "WARM" :)
then the policey peps came and said hi :) so I got a chance to ..walk
around, talk to peoples and stuff :) Spencer was supposed to be spinning
soon at this time :( and I had brought some cool CDs we were going to
play but we never got the chance :(! but its cool, because we get to do
it at the next  :)

back to the good stuff tho...
I didn't get to taste the Chai...but it seemed good ;) hehe :)
the fruits were delicious :) and the decorations were pretty :)
I liked the black-suady-blanket thingy in the main room it was
confortable but it left stays on my jeans :) hehehe...rave-funk!
thats what rave-jeans are for :) 

I just want to Thank all the people who helped throw/setup this party
for all the effort they put into it :) [*phat hugs*] I'm looking forward
to the next warmth already ;) PHAT hugs to all the DJs that spun, I
hella enjoyed the music :) who was that DJ that was playing ROBERT
MILES' "CHILDREN" hella fast? I likes :))) 

In any case. ...time for bed :) 
Hi to allzs and gonite to allzs :)
Much Love and Hugs and Glitter and Candy and Stickers :)
{*HUGSHUGSHUHGUS*}
Pablito

PS: Rhona!! thanks for the treat :)))) I needed that one ;) {*HUGSHUGS*}
  -I know I know..you are not on the list, but just wannted to let
   everyone on it know who wonderful you are ;) {*HUGS*}

C-yas
Pab

>Ameba will be closing before the Gregorian Month of June 1997 is over.
>
>Please come down for a final fairwell on Sunday June 8th during the Haight
>>Street Fair. We will be dancing in the store. Please come and buy
>everything. >After the 8th everything in the store will be 1/2 off.

This is certainly a sad rave moment and may be fortelling of other changs
in the future.  For those who have been around long enough you knew that
Ameba was rave central.  You could call the store and find out about
parties.  Before everyone became a DJ you could find good DJ tapes from the
top DJ's of the time.

in '92 the store was really hitting.  You couldn't go to Toon Town and not
see some of their designs on the dancefloor or hanging from the roof.  The
store has truly been the epicenter of this whole thing for a while.  One
must wonder what has happened?  A change in styles and tastes, people
getting off the dancefloor and behind the dex.  Yikes! I'm sad to see such
a rave/party institution vanish.  Oh well...change is inevitable.

Good luck Alan & all the other amebites with all your future projects,
John

At 8:01 PM -0700 5/31/97, Brian Behlendorf wrote:
>On Sat, 31 May 1997, John S. Lee wrote:
>> If you have amplified sound I think it is
>> difficult to tell others they cannot do the same unless the primary holder
>> is given jurisdiction and it is enforced by someone.
>
>Yes, enforced by the BLM rangers, local sheriffs office, and the private
>landowner.  If they think you're a nuisance or a danger you won't be
>staying, even if you do get in.  Why seek confrontation?  Why not work
>*with* the people organizing this to see what can be done?  Folks have
>talked about the "rave village" concept, lots of small (but still plenty
>loud) systems kept near central camp.  I think this is great - I'm hoping
>to spin a downtempo/ambient set at camp WBL one night, myself.

The point is not confrontation but human nature.  When told no, the human
has a natural tendency to say yes.  Even if the reasons for a no answer are
valid.  I consider this our animal tendency.  In any case I see your point,
I just hope other abide.

>

 Ok..  I got my mixer. Numark 1800X phat, dope, azz, does everything I want
it to nStuff!
 And now. I am puting in an order for some new needles and... Well. I have
run into a bit of confusion.

 I want the best needles and. Looking at Ortofons.. It looks like the "NEW"
Ortofon Concorde DJ E is the best.
 But there is one thing that is making me wonder.

 I am wondering if the Concorde Night Club E is actually better than the
Concorde DJ E..
The Night Club E specifies that it is great for scratching and
back-tracking. But the DJ E does not specify that.. So it makes me wonder.

 My first instict would be to assume that the Concorde DJ E is also great
for scratching nStuff. But I can't find no specs that specify it...
 Anybody know?
 Is it the Ortofon Concorde DJ E
 or do I get the Ortofon Concorde Night Club E needles?

institutionalized component of out community disapear.  I have a lot of
pride for Rave-Born industries (stores, record companies, clubs,
venders....) and it is defenetly a sign of the times are changing!

Hi kids,

I just realized (thanks to Rubilicious) that I partied 4 days straight. 

On Thursday I was at Mirasol, Friday I went to RETURN TO THE SOURCE,
Saturday I went to Warmth and sunday I went to SunSet.

I have to say that Sunset was BEAUTIFUL. It was my first and definately
not my last. I'm going to go every time now. It was awesome. I cruied down
to DJ BLOOM's house to pick him up with ED.. and we hung out there and
BLOOM spun for us... it was awesome. Then we went to Sunset and really
enjoyed ourselves. The two blondies. (ed's a blonde now!). We ate left
over pizza and nice cold beer... then I watched the sun set down on the
beach.. this would be so nice to share with that special someone in your
lives... it's so spiritual and inspriring.. it would be cool to propose to
someone as the sun exited our view. Just a thought.

let see... I saw so many of you this weekend and was able to meet a few
more!.... too bad Elena missed me at the Cala Foods... (she was late!)...
This was definately a grade A weekend. I had so much fun.

Well.... back to work!... Yahoo! Happy,Happy, Joy, Joy!... :'P

(---- Byroni -----)

ps. anyone else going to Nikita on Friday to see DJ DIMITRI (sp?) of
DeeeLite? Ed and I are going... some of you should as well!

--* HUGZ *--

Well, I must say this was a very nice sunset.  Good house music.  I haven't
heard so much house in the longest time till this weekend.  It was a great
change of pace from my norm.  The vibe was very very good.  There must have
been close to if not 600-700 people there.  Nice one! =)

Hello to all the people I met and talked with.  To many names to write
down, but you all know who you are.

The only down point for me was the wind kicking up dust.  And let me tell
you it was pretty windy at one point....=)  Other than that excellent
gathering.  See you all at the next one.

good day everybody!

i want to say how proud i was of all of you kind and wonderfull kids.  it 
was a real embarrasment to me to have to turn the music off around 
4:30am.  but what fallowed i felt was almost as incredible as what i felt 
when the music was on...connection.  even though the music whent off most 
of you stayed!  i saw hundreds of people just kicking back and enjoying 
time together, sharing stories, energy, and love...and when you all 
helped me sing happy birthday to my good friend rob i could have cried!  
you kids stuck it out 
and even though the music was off for 1 and a half hours the party still 
whent to 6am!  thank you for your kind understanding and enduring energy.

i do want to make everyone aware of what happened as embarrased as i am.  
it turns out some ambitious people took the initiative and opened some 
windows.  obviously they must have been very hot, the heat was 
deffanitely an issue and a problem so who can blame these good people for 
oppening a window to get a breath of fresh air, i certainly can't, i can 
only blame myself for not supopling better circulation. 

unfortunately open windows allowed the energy and sound out of the space 
and some folks down the block, who where no dobt trying to sleep at 4 in 
the morning, decided to call san francisco's finest and have this 
intrusion of thier restfull night put to an end. 

well we would not let 
them put an end to the party or the love that was preasent there but they 
did take away our music, an event that i must appolagize for and accept 
responsability.  I am sorry, very sorry about that.

well, i just wanted to get that off my chest.  Thanks to everyone who 
helped out and put real time and effort into making the tingle theory 
happen.  I am beamming with pride and fulfilment after saturday night, 
again you kids blasted through problems and showed me how wonderful and 
inspireing people can be!

love
spencer

Date: Sun, 01 Jun 1997 23:27:52 +0000
From: Mike Wertheim <mw@cyborganic.net>

Subject: (event 6/15) Anti Prohibition Rally

If you would like to volunteer to help in putting on this event,
please send me some mail (mw@cyborganic.net).  We need lots of
people to help put up and distribute flyers, and to help out
at the event itself.

*******************************************************************
***            JOIN THE INTERNATIONAL DRUG PEACE RALLY!         ***
*******************************************************************    

  A Peaceful, Law-abiding Rally to Celebrate Global Anti-Prohibition Day

                       Sunday, June 15th, 1997

          We welcome all people to gather peacefully in support of 
          an end to the Drug War - A costly, unjust and unwinnable 
          war that is needlessly imprisoning non-violent Americans 
                  and infringing upon our civil liberties!

                  International Drug Peace March and Rally
                  ----------------------------------------
                          Sunday, June 15th, 1997
                             Civic Center Plaza
                   Located at the corner of Hyde and Grove
                         San Francisco, California
  
                              Rally Schedule:
                              ---------------
               Noon           - Assemble on the Plaza for March
               12:30pm        - White Flag March begins
               1:30-5:30pm    - Rally featuring well-known Speakers 
                                and Entertainers
               1:30-5:30pm    - Dance Celebration with DJ's by C.C.C.
and
                                Koinonea

                   Information Booths, Exhibits and Petitions

        *** Please Bring a White Flag of Truce to Symbolize our ***
        ***       United Quest for Peace in the Drug War!      
***       

     This event is being sponsored by the Legalize! Initiative - An 
     International action forum for all people concerned by the damage 
     currently being done to society by the War on Drugs.  This event is 
     being coordinated with parallel anti-prohibition rallies in 
     New York, Toronto, Amsterdam, and Brisbane.  Other cities are also 
     welcome to participate.

     For more information, please browse our Website at:
     http://www.legalize.org, or leave a message at (510) 412-1055. 
     Volunteers are needed and much appreciated.  Please spread the
word!

---------- Forwarded message ----------
Date: Mon, 2 Jun 1997 10:38:09 -0700
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
From: Nic Grell <grell@sonic.net>
Subject: WARMTH my favorite party ever

This is my warmth review but i have to go to work so ill make it quick

  I arrived at around 6:30 to help set up and I knew it was gonna be a hell
of a night as soon as parked my big blue cadillac right in front and was
greeted by big hugs from everyone. 

  first of all i'd lke to thank spencer and everyone that helped out with
organizing this party.  the first coulple of hours i spent wandering around
catching up with old friends and meeting new ones.  and of course i had tons
of long warm hugs and kissed for everyone of them.  the people at this party
realy did it for me.  I still get the total tingle through my body when I
think about it.

  some of you may remember me as the one going through the rooms trying to
get everyone together for the gigantic group hug.  some how i ended up in
the middle of the hug and i was sooo happy somebody looked at me and said
why are you crying.  I didnt realize I even was.  I could feel such great
vibesw flowing into me from everyone involved.  It was quite a spiratual
experiance. thank you. 

 then when micron was on i tried to dance for a while cause he was tearing it up
at one point my to best friends came and grabbed me and dragged me in there.
one of our favorite songs was on and we stood trere and hugged for a while
and loved one another.

  the rest of the morning i spent with a very special girl from vacaville
named lisa.  we just layed on the matresses and cuddled through the night
and there is no way I would ever want to change that part of the night.  but
one part of the night that I would want to change was my friend clay tried
to call in sick so he could go out to coffe with us but they wouldnt let him
and we were all very sad.

thanks everyone of you.
                       love seth

     though, the craziest part was dancing in the sauna in the rear of the 
     building.  the heat told me to go away but the music always brought me 
     back for more!  What was the list of dj's back there, and approximate 
     times?  I would love to get some mixtapes of some of that.

     cool enough to keep me beaming.

I felt the warmth and connectivity.  I hope everyone who attended did
also. For those who were unable to attend, I hope  you can feel the
warmth from the many reviews.  

Warmth is just one of those party's that no matter what happens people
stay together.  People attend to see/hear/feel the music, but they are
really there to spread their love and warmth to all.  I had such a
wonderful  time/expiernce.  I just can't put it too words. 

I went with the love of my life (Stefi) because Warmth is where it all
began for us.  We may not currently be together but we still share many
woderful moments together.  

I broke my promise too her. I promised her that I would not work at all
at Warmth, just attend it an enjoy a party together for once.  But of
course a young teenage girl needed my EMT skills so I helped out and got
the girl back on her feet.  I knew this would be ok with Stefi because a
human life is far greater than anything else to us.  

I am sorry to side track but I felt I needed to say that last bit.  I
hope all who attended had a woderful time and many woderful moments as I
had.  I hope to see you all at the next Warmth.  

Please I can't emphasize enogh PLEASE BE SAFE, we all love you and want
you to take care of yourself so you can still be present with us.



		I Am Filled With A Well Of Love For All,
			Please Borrow All You Need Of Me,
				To Return What Was Borrowed,
					Give Your Love To Someone Else Who Needs It


			Matthew Lewis Downer (AKA Elmo)

> From: Troy Sheets <tsheets@saturn5.com>
> To: Mr nStuff@work <stuff@hooked.net>
> Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.com
> Subject: Re: DJ Equipment Question.
> Date: Monday, June 02, 1997 11:36 AM
> 
> 
> Both these needles come in spherical and eliptical versions.  Thats the
> shape of the needle itself.  Sphereical needles are what you want for
> scratching and back-spinning.  Elipticals sound the best, but are
designed
> to play the record in only 1 direction.   So, you can go with either the
> night club or DJ E needles, along as you get either one in spherical
versions.
> 
> happy spinning,
> -troy
> 
> 
> > 
> > Hey ravErs nStuff!   =]:
> > 
> >

want
> > it to nStuff!
> >  And now. I am puting in an order for some new needles and... Well. I
have
> > run into a bit of confusion.

the
> > Concorde DJ E..

pain pain pain. i slept from friday afternoon (after that horrible
wisdom tooth yank out) til saturday evening, just in time for the
warmth party. didn't think i'd make it, but i'm
SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO
glad i did! :)

i've been raving fer about a year & a half or so and i must say, this
was the bestest party i've ever been to. don't know if it was the
music the people or what but you all made it into the bombest party
ever ever ever! YOU'RE ALL SO BEAUTIFUL!!! 

MICRON YOU ROCKED!!!! i was dancing fer daaaaays! oh the joy! :)

i was kinda tweeked out that night. the pure um.. stuff made the tooth
pain go away but i felt a little dreamy and you were all so adorable!
i kinda started wanting to kiss everyone, hehe but luckily my
boyfriend stopped me :) heehee

I LOVE YOU GUYS SOOOO MUCH!!!! (mind you i'm sober right now:) i was
the happiest little camper saturday night. met so many wun-dur-ful
people can't remember names but i sure do remember your beautiful
faces :) :)

i wanted to see macadio spin but my ride wanted to leave early :(
<pout>
i promise next time, i'll stay to hear your set and promise to dance
dance dance til it ends!!! :) 

i didn't mind the heat.. one of the few... i think if you just say "aw
screw the heat" and delve into it, it feels hella good :) okay so i
was sweating balls and it was kinda gross but :) heehee

justin loved the chill room and the pads... woooooooo what a great
place to just lie down and stare at the visuals on the wall :) the
location decorations whoah! loved it loved it loved it! and the
SFRAVES WALL and the touchy feeling wall was so rad. i wrote in the
book drew a picture of myself :)

okay so i'm being super super super duper happy. 
i met this hella cool guy that told me when you're peaking on.. stuff,
do something like press against your wrist really hard for like a few
minutes, and then the next day or whenever, you press on your wrist
again, and you'll feel like how you felt at the rave :) so that's why
i'm a bit ecstatic! :)

anyways back to work...
"good afternoon octel..."

<HUGS&slOPPYWETKISSIESheehee>

(:<veann<:)

                      Warmth <3 <3 (Review Long)                   06.02.1997

Hey all of you sfravers!

I hope all of you had a great weekend!  I sure did. =)  Warmth was a beautiful party. Lets see, our night began with a great pasta dinner, because we all need our carbos for energy. We got around to the ritual process of, glitter, sticker, candy, toys, etc. =)  We eventually hopped in the car and headed towards San Francisco.  We made a quick stop in Palo Alto to pick up a fellow SF raver w/ out a ride. (Hi Diego)

We arrived at the party and I saw, nothing but smiling people.  I scanned the dance studio. I liked how all of the rooms were open!  I noticed that I hadn't even started dancing, but I started sweating.  It was pretty steamy in there.  : P I wanted a place to sit. So I found the Neon face painter.  I went wild with that. If any of you saw me I had a design on my face.  Lance, (I hope that is your name) you made sitting there for 20 min. bearable. Thanks, and I hope to see you soon. 

After I got familiar with the space and said my hellos, I wanted to go dance!!!!  My best friend Ora said that Micron was spinning. =) He was so awesome! Even though I was dripping sweat, he still "took mE thErE" Thanks for the Laminate Micron, you are such a sweety.

I relaxed for a while in the chill room. Loved the black lights!  And I finally made it to where Boomerang was spinning.  I danced for a little while. (Scott, I looked for you. Ora told me you were around, maybe next time. =) )  Hey Candy Christine, where were ya this weekend??Ben and Iris, did you go?? I looked around for you.To all of the Warmth people, thanks for a great party! The fruit was nice!  If I forgot to thank anyone else, thank you!  I love you all!!! =)

Have a good week!
Much love, and smiles

Julie
*fairy princess*

*B* wrote:
> I spend almost every day... meeting people >>who
> also believe in qualities some of us do, but who don't necessarilylike
> listening to techno, and staying up all night.

There is only one problem non-ravers have with loud rave sound system 
and that is ...it is loud.  Not everyone likes rave music. When you 
plunk down a huge system, everyone has to listen to it. One of the few 
rules of BM is..Not to interfere with anyones immiediate expierience. 
Very few other festivals have gone to the trouble to accomidate ravers.

The BM project is really happy that Feel Good Expierience is throwing a 
Real Rave. One that is close to hospitals and can provide the amount of 
drinking water neccasary. With a McDonalds nearby, And most 
important(dont take this lightly!)   Flushing toilets!!!! None of these 
things are available at a festival that glorys in self suffieciency of 
its participants.

Once again, let me stress that *Ravers Are Welcome*. This year I believe 
that Ravers will prove how important they are to the whole vibe of BM. 
This year is the year we start building Villages. Gather your friends 
together, build a large shade structure, stock pile ice chests, gather 
equipment for a communakl kitchen,

>good day everybody!
>
>i want to say how proud i was of all of you kind and wonderfull kids.  it

>when the music was on...connection.  even though the music whent off most

>whent to 6am!  thank you for your kind understanding and enduring energy.

Subject: :) WARMTH :)
To: bassbabies <sfraves@hyperreal.com>
Message-ID: <Pine.3.89.9706021430.A10268-0100000@ucdata.Berkeley.EDU>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; CHARSET=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk


Hats off to the Warmth crew for putting on one of the _best_ parties I 
have ever been to!

With just two parties, Warmth has established itself at the heart of the
SF rave scene.  The vibe there Saturday night was akin to what I've
experienced at Friends and Family and the best Harmonys, and reminded me
of why I'm in this scene and the power of what we're creating together. 
Thanks to everyone who was there for restoring my fading faith in
openness, friendship and connection among Ravers.  I haven't felt unity
like that in a long while, and it's amazing.  The experience we are all
lucky enough to have - of what it is like to leave mistrust behind and
welcome others with a loving heart - is something more powerful and 
special than a lot of us probably realize.  It is choosing to treat 
others with kindness and openness rather than alienate ourselves through 
fear and cynicism.  It is choosing a different way to be in this life, 
and the joy we have felt in that moment of connection is transformative.  
It is hard not to be changed when you really get what has happened.  Nights 
like at Warmth show us what happens when we choose positivity, and the 
rewards that are possible, if we choose to do it.

I ran into a friend from Berkeley who was at his first rave.  He sat 
dazed in the chill room, and spoke of feeling his everyday cynicism 
melting away, and feeling liberated (ah, we bagged another one!!).  
The newbie friend I brought simply called it "awesome."

I was so surprised to read what Spencer wrote, because after the music 
ended was the most inspiring part of the night for me.  I had always felt 
that the music made the party, first and foremost.  But at Warmth, the 
cops shut off our music at 4AM,  but that didn't stop the party.  I saw 
hundreds of people just chilling together, laughing and talking and 
buzzing with positive energy.  Music was no longer the glue holding us 
together - there was only all of us just being together, and that was one 
of the most special things I have experienced in the scene.  We left at 
5:30, and the party was still going strong :).

Not to mention the dazzling environment - beautiful decorations, light 
shows, the touchy-feeling wall!, the SFRaves alter where people drew and 
wrote, the oranges and grapes in the morning, the frosty Chai, the 
massage table, a bunch of great toys, and of course the clean and 
good-sized dance studio (with all rooms open!).

Downsides were of course the heat.  Micron was throwing down a slamming
set in the early part of the night, and I could only sluggishly move in
the Sauna.  After that, the combination of heat with lazy, jazzy tunes
meant I (and a lot of other people) didn't dance... but, for once (at
least for me), the music wasn't the focus of the event. 

This is probably my last party in the Bay Area (I leave in two weeks).  
The party was so good that when I was there I started reconsidering 
moving away!!  But now I am just so happy that my last Bay Area rave was 
also one of the very best... thank you all for all the memories over the 
years.

Also HI! to all the SFRavers I met and re-met Saturday night.  Too many 
to name (but you know who you are! :)  LOTS of people wore their 
laminates :) and the alter turned out to be a great meeting place - let's 
do that more often!!

Still feeling fuzzy,
Nancy

The British couple is staying at my computer-less house right now, so if 
anyone needs to reach them you can leave a message for them on my machine 
at (510) 548-8718.   I think they're still looking for places to stay if 
anyone would be kind enough to put them up for a night or two (you know 
those budget ravers!)

anyone is going and has room.

sleeping arrangements.  So, I think they're going to conk out for a couple 
of days here in quiet Berkeley, and emerge in a little while to party 
with you all again :).

> 
> they know my tracks they're going to bite my style" bullshit? Each DJ
> offers a unique perspective to a combination of records creating more than
> just the sum of those records played end to end during a set. (Hopefully,
> anyway) I've heard DJ's play a track in a way that completely amazes me,
> yet when I hear the track on it's own I'm utterly bored. And conversely,
> I've heard some of my favorite tracks sound completely flat out at a club
> somewhere.

also I've seen Djs take two not very interesting records, beat match them
keep them in the mix, and create something that really rocks; and truly is
as original as what the producers created.  Some records are made to be half
(if not a third) of a DJs performance.  What bugs me are DJs who play those
records alone and we get to hear the same 4-beat pattern 64x - _boring_.

sd

Ya know something,

I bitched at Brian about moderating the list.  I went on and on about
letting people discuss what they will before bringing out the firehose.
But now it is all happening again, albeit much more slowly than last time.
NRR posts are starting to invade the list again.  Soon, it'll be pages to
so and so, then all out fights.

If this list gets more NRR stuff I would then think moderation is the only
way to maintain order.  C'mon people, let's stop the NRR stuff.  Let's keep
the list nice and rave like with rave and party oriented subjects.  Poems
about warm and fuzzy feelings w/o mention of beat one, should be relegated
to alt.poetry.

If you have comments, please e-mail me privately.  Now please, let's keep
the NRR posts to a minimum.

Why do we not seem to learn from even the most recent mistakes.

Late,
john

it is the rule." - Neitzche

At first I wasn't going to attend this party due to my ride situation, but

possible. Yay BART.

This was a rilly fun party and the music was soooooo incerdible. DJ Dan was

decide where to stay! The overall vibe was cool, lots of friendly people, and
lollipops!

were forced to sit on. 

I hope that everyone else who went had an awesome time, and those that missed

Hello my loves!

	Well i just wanted to let you all know that iam still alive and true love is
still going to go off. The last couple of weeks i have been in a battle with
tring to get well. Most of you all know that a  month or so ago i almost died
because of a bad bad infection, well i went in for emergency surgery on my
mouth. what had happened is i was in the process of getting a root canal done
and an infection sprung up, so they had to waite to do the root canal, and
the infection began to spred up into my face. i began to have unberable pain
and woke up the next  morning to have the whole left side of my face swollen
beyond belife, i was completly unreconizable, were the whole thing got bad
was the infection was about 4 in from my brain, my surgen said that i was
lucky and got in just in time if i would of waited one more day to take any
action i most likely would of been in critical condition, and just may not of
made it. Well that is all under control thank god, but now the infection has
moved into my jaw bone, i go in for surgery this friday to get this thing out
of my life and be on the road to being completly well! 

	So iam sorry if i have not been getting back to you all with the wedding and
all but iam sure you all understand. i have been to a couple of parties since
this but only because of prior comentments to them, and belive me i thought
twice before going because i was scared and hell so was my mom since i would
be so far away from home. i wont be parting for awhile because after my
sugery i need to get my self completly well and start putting all my enery
into my wedding and getting intouch with all of you! no i havent forgot you
all and your willingness to want to help with this beautiful chapter in my
life, and i will be sitting down and calling you all personly next week. i
will be getting a meeting together for sometime this month, and i will let
you all know when thats together and ready to go, we have alot of things to
talk about!

	so please you all just bear with me right now i am doing my best but i need
to be completly together before i can work on anything else! thank you all
for understanding, i love you all so much, and i cant waite to talk to you
all! iam sorry if i dident say bye to any of you sat night at warmth (phat
party by the way) but i had a little bit of minor stuff done on my mouth
earlier that day, then rushed down to help set up and ended up getting really
ill by the middle of the night, some of it had to do with the work i had done
on my mouth so after that i realy knew it was time to take a break and get
well. i will be getting intoch with you all next week i just want to be
totally centered on the whole thing when i talk to you all, and by next week
my notes, mind, and body should be reven to go! so i love you all very much!
thank you for your patchients with this whole thing and all your love and
support, but most of all thanks so much for just being who you are! you guys
are so grat iam feelen all fuzzy thinkinking of all of you ohhhhhh i miss you
all so much kisses kisses huggies huggies did you get all that! good you all
deserve it! well i best be going beddie by for dustins waiting for me and hes

hey there sfravers,

just wanted to let everyone know that we have plenty of the warmth CDs 
left for ppl who wanted to pick one up at the party but didn't get to. 

we've been working on this cd project ever since the first _warmth_....
we created this CD for YOU...as a souvenier, as a way to commemorate the 
experience that is _warmth_  and as a way to always bring you back to the 
collective energy and love that flows at a _warmth_ party. 

In case anyone didn't get a chance to check it out...it is a double disc 
set featuring Micron and Macadio, and Thad and Deepfog. 
Digitally mastered, full color graphics, track listings, pictures, and 
more. 
They will soon be available in a few record stores...(once we get a 
chance to drop them off) I'll post the locations soon :)

But in the meantime you can get them directly from us...just send an 
email or give a call and we'll put together a collective time/place for 
everyone to pick up copies...and soon. 



XOR Records

hola sfrrraverrrs!

finally, a moment to sit down and express thoughts about WARMTH,

1st a million + thank yous to all involved w/ the organization, your 
are super humans! especially Spencer ;)  

what a glorious VIBE!

my best buddie ~CHRISTI~, i love you!  and to ~Orson n Ma66ie~ [thanks 
for the laminate!] ~Rubilicious & Ivan~ [cute sis n bro!], ~Peter~ 
[you are an amazing artist!] ~Omar~ [muchos besos guapo!] ~Robert~ [we 
remembered each other from the first Warmth!] ~DeReK~ [hey cutie!] and 
~Byroni~ sorry i was late ;/  ~Macadio~ sorry you didn~t get to spin

i leave you w/ a thought by Lama Anagarika Govinda
  <<The secret of concealed power of the sound of the vibration, the 
creative power, as it reveals the nature of things and the phenonema 
of life, as well known to the prophets of ancient times...Pythagoras, 
himself an initiate of eastern wisdom, spoke of the "harmony of the 
spheres," whereby each heavenly body--and this also applies to every 
atom--produces a special tone peculiar to it alone on the basis of its 
movement, rhythm, or vibrations. All these tones and harmonies form a 
universal harmony in which every element, regardless of whether it 
retains its own function and character, contributes to the unity of 
the whole. Every atom continually sings a song, and in every moment 
the tone creates dense and fine forms>>

remind you of anything?!
Love, ~e~l~e~n~a~

hello sfravers

you guys dont know me because i live in la, but i just wanted to write to
thank y'all for the awesome time i had at warmth last sat night. i was in
sf for the weekend and had never been to a bay area rave before. i wasnt
sure what kind of crowd to expect, just slightly worried because i heard
the people at The Infinity Project were not the PLURiest kind, not mean,
just not very friendly. Id left all my raver-wear at home, all i had was my
black t-shirt and 501s and my own piece of the vibe, and i brought a friend
who had never been to a rave before, we had the most unbelievable time!

highlights for me:

i did not know whatsoever what the lineup was and exactly who was spinning,
but as soon as i got there, someone was spinning "7 Days & 1 Week" yay!
danced my wiggin ass off! will this be on the Warmth cd?

played with a bunch of some girls stuffed animals, including a little
stuffed frog. "he doesn't have a name" she says "oh" i reply "help me think
of a name" "um... all i can think of is kermit" i say, she apparently
doesn't like that "whats your name?" she asks "joe" i say and she responds
matter-of-factly "his name's joe!" and so i hugged her gleefully, so
flattered was i! i get such a warm fuzzy smile across my face just thinking
about it...

some girl gave me her two blue glowsticks so i started going around and
tripping people out on the dance floor with them, waving them around
peoples' heads and so forth. god, how i loved the wonderful smiles and
looks of joyousness that spread on peoples' faces!

i liked the way the music was stopped at one point to cool the room down so
that everybody got a chance to rest together at the same time. everything
felt so tight, together, and communal by this simple act, just everybody
resting up and talking together. i needed it and i was grateful.

met a couple of you listers, one guy scott from sacramento gave my friend
and i a ride from f-8 to the place, thanks! another named joe just like
myself gave me a cool laminate that said "e"! unfortunately he duct-taped
it to my shirt and it fell off later. i felt very sad about losing it...

before stopping, i just want to add that you guys are some of the greatest
around, i love your scene, i so much want to go back so that i can party
with all of you again. thanks for the wonderful time, love and hugz to all
the new friends i made and ones i have yet to meet!!

joe

one of my best friends in high school just came back from college in
humboldt <sp?> and was telling me about the rave scene there - there
is none. some of the locals there tried to throw one but didn't have a
clue as to what they were doing. tons of people showed up... but no
one music was produced.... except for a stereo and a few cds.

anyways my point is, i wanna gather up a whole bunch of you
wun-dur-ful people, shove you all in a van (or several vans) and TAKE
A ROADTRIP TO HUMBOLDT!!!! :) :) :) :)

mind you i have no idea how to throw a rave but i totally think it
would be soooo cool if we showed the fellow neighbors some love, great
vibe and awesome music. 

the cool thing is that in humboldt (said by maureen) is that the cops
are more laid back. and there's tons of barns with no houses
surrounding it, just forests everywhere :) so we wouldn't have to
worry about waking up the neighbors :)

i totally want to do this and i really need your help. justin and i 
will be heading down humboldt in mid august just to visit and go
mushroom hunting woowoo :) and perhaps find a cool space where we can
have it. so if any of you want to help out, or go up to humboldt with
us, please email me back. CAN'T DO IT WITHOUT YOU! :)

lotsalovebabeee!

(:>veann<:)

Man o Man,
	Talk about Great Music.  I Love the Music we all listen to.  Their is 
no other that can compare.  I can feel no other in my veins as I do with 
the rhythms and beats spun by our DJ's and performed by the musicians.  
I realized this all over again at Believe.
	We arrived at 10:30pm and Jazz-E was spinning in the main room.  I had 
a few people come up and ask me who was spinning because according to 
them "He Rocked".  And Jazz-E did Rock.  I heard him at FGE, but this 
was incredible.  After Jazz-E spun, UberZone performed live.  I know DJ 
Ghost was there to hear UberZone because Ghost spins breakbeat and 
UberZone played some Phat BreakBeats.  He played that song.."What is the 
Brain doing, What is the Brain doing?"  That was Flocking Sick.  When he 
was done, DJ Dan got on the decks.  Whoa!  did I say Whoa!?  I know DJ 
Dan is a master spinner, but Wow!  Jam after Jam after Jam.  The visual 
Japanamation on the screens was fun to look at.  I was staring at the 
screen and I saw something floating toward me (on the screen).  I 
couldn't tell what it was.  But as it came closer and closer, I realized 
it was the word "Pascal" floating towards me, indicating that Pascal was 
now spinning.  And at that same time, I heard a song come on repeating 
the word "Believe...Believe...Believe"  And the Beat was tight.  I Loved 
that song.  I felt like jumping up and down until my head hit the 
ceiling.  Major props to ERMODA for such a success and a Great Party.  
Yes the Heat was bad, but the Big Ass Fans were very refreshing.  Did 
anybody else notice that the water tasted like shit?  The floor was 
dirty, but then again I'm always dancing and never sitting so it didn't 
really matter to me.  It was packed, but this was at the same place as 
Harmony Spring Massive and I heard that Harmony was more packed and 
Hotter.  That's enough for me.  Time to split like a Banana.

Josh "e" Josh  "Any activity becomes creative when the doer cares about 
doing it right, or better."    -John Updike

I've been quite lathargic in giving my review of this awesome party but I
just can't stand it anymore.  IT WAS THE DOPEST PARTY SINCE
SUPERLOVE!!!!!  Gosh, I just loved it.  I brought my friend who was new
to raving and he loved it. 

First off, I would like to give thanks to Micron (I think) for spinning
"Hardcore Vibes" by DUNE.  That was one of the first techno songs I heard
in hospital in Germany that ignited my love of techno back in '95.

N E WAYS, I have never seen so many damn SFRaves laminates.  It was
totally crazy cool.  Good to see Orson and Maggies excellent shrine.  I
left my mark in the book.  It was cool seeing Elena, (am I really cute or
just cute?), Chrsti, (thanks for the smoke), Macadio, (oh, well, there
will be other times I can watch you rock the house.), and the countless
others I said howdy to.  I think I sweated out part of my brain so I
can't remember everyone I said HI to.

The DJ's were great and the live techno in the Chill Room was awesome. 
Every room was a pleasure to be in.  The vibe was so thick that I found
it difficult to walk through it and be everywhere at once.

To sum it up:  THIS PARTY HAS THE EXCELLENT HONOR OF HAVING THE          
                                LAMINATED TICKET HANG ON THE WALL IN MY
BEDROOM.

To everyone who set up, ya'll did a great job.

dErEk

think?

sometime soon. if any of y'all would like a copy, email me or her, K?

gee, i'm like all unfocused today...hee..ohs well... i luv u all! aren't
sfravers just the raddest?

Sorry for posting this to the list, but I want to know other peoples
opinions on this. I think the NRR's are sometimes really cool.... and I
enjoy the variety or different types of messages on here rather than
ABSOLUTELY everything having to do with raves.... like many people have
said before.... thing about the rave scene is it's diversity and
differences... I like the NRR's.... they sometimes show what other
people are interested in, or interest other people. if you truly didn't
want anything that's not rave related on the sfraves mailing list, you
shouldn't of posted what you posted.... it's not about raves or the
scene... it's about moderating a mailing list. Now I ask the others on
the list what they think about the NRR's? I like 'em... and if you
don't.... the great thing about NRR's is that they are NRR's and are
easy to delete when you don't have time to read them.

love.and.peace to ya'll, jer

on another note:
just to let ya'll happy posters and flamers know.... the reason we have
so many lurkers is because they're afraid to post to the list because
they don't want to get flamed. I met a lot of them at WARMTH =) and
that's what they said. =( poor guys.... to bad there's so much stinkin'
flamin' on the list here.

>> Let's keep the list nice and rave like with rave and party oriented
>>subjects.
>> Poems about warm and fuzzy feelings w/o mention of beat one, should be
>> relegated to alt.poetry.


I don't post very often, but here are my thoughts on this: It's a
community. Yes, there is music, and parties. There is much more than that
as well. The emotions and other *human* stuff that people need to share
with each other is a relevant part of our culture. There is art created by
ravers... There is poetry created by ravers... If these things are inspired
by such scene, and said events, then (imo) they are not only relevant, but
necessary... In other words, they are alternative forms of
communication/expression. An essential part of the lifeblood that keeps us
together. Let us not ban something so integral... This is a good forum. I'm
glad its here, in whatever creative form it takes on.

-Joshua

At 12:07 1997-06-03 -0700, [nl] wrote:
>>> Let's keep the list nice and rave like with rave and party oriented
>>>subjects.
>>> Poems about warm and fuzzy feelings w/o mention of beat one, should be
>>> relegated to alt.poetry.

>I don't post very often, but here are my thoughts on this: It's a
>community. Yes, there is music, and parties. There is much more than that
>as well. The emotions and other *human* stuff that people need to share
>with each other is a relevant part of our culture.

I agree. Most of you probably remember me as the super-spamming spaceboy.
But seriously, if it hadn't been for the support I got from the people on
this list when I was depressed, I would not have been able to pull through.
I'm not sure I would have been able to stay sane for as long as I did. I'm
not saying that this list should be used as a substitute for REAL friends,
but sometimes it's all we have. (and oh, a lot of the people are friends
of mine in real life as well, and I'm thankful for the opportunity to meet
them!!!)

So, if you need to post something that you think interests anyone on this
list, or it's somehow related to the scene AS A WHOLE (that means that it
doesn't have to include the letters B,P, and M...), GO FOR IT!!!
If you don't want to read NRR posts, get a mail program with a filtering
function.

And whatever you do, don't stop loving the music, or the people around you.

love and huggies,
jonas THE SPACEBOY WHO WISHES HE WENT TO WARMTH... =)

Subject: Warmth and Happiness
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com

   I can't even begin to explain the incredible vibe I received from this 
party. It's monday morning, and happy mad beats are still rushing through
my head!

   First I gotta say that there has not been a time in my life where I 
have met so may incredibily friendly, interesting, and completely awsome 
people. That's what made this party what it was. The people. I usualy
would go off now and start naming names but I met soooo many people that
I wouldn't even know where to begin. One name I gotsta mention though. 
Spencer...you are the man! :)

   For this party the vibe began at 3:30 pm, so many people putting thier 
heart and soul into the atmosphere and the excitment was so thick you 
couldn't cut it with a dull butter knife. I had to leave at about 4:45 
but when I got back at 8:15 the vibe had grown ten-fold, it was really 
intense, and it made me soooo incredibly happy to be a part of it, and 
the party had not even started yet!

   Once it did start things only got better. I did my usual running around
trying to meet as many people as possible and I knew from then this was a
really special party because I hadn't met one person who wasn't boppin'
thier head or didn't have a huge smile across thier face.  The music was
simply awsome! I unfortunately didn't catch all of micron's set but
everytime I went into that room it was jam packed! and EVERYONE was
dancing, unlike anything I've ever seen at that place. Sure, it was hot, 
Sure someone complained and I was pretty bummed that macadio didn't get a 
chance to spin, but this incredible vibe just didn't quit. With or 
without music, we pulled together as one great big family to make this 
amazing party by far the best I've been to yet...ok, I guess I'm being a 
little redundant now so I'll stop :) you get the point!  

WARMTH WAS AWSOME!

Stay cool everyone!

Matt - the newer one *8^)


P.S. Gotta thank Jeff and Ari for giving me my first lesson on spinning!
     It's SOOOOOOOOOOOOO addictive :)

To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
From: Jenn Farago <sprout@vibe.org>
Subject: NRR: Please, Read the SFR Welcome Message!!!
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

>If you don't want to read NRR posts, get a mail program with a filtering
>function.

People shouldn't *have* to go out and get a mail program with filters.
People *should* be able to be on a list and expect the people to be
somewhat considerate of each other by following the guidelines and enjoy
what it has to offer with or without filters. Besides, if you pay close
attention to the welcome message about this list it gives specific
guidelines as to what this list is about... here is a direct quote for all
of you who missed it...

"Appropriate topics include:
  Announcements of upcoming bay area events
  Reviews of previous events/DJ's/new records, etc
  SF-related and rave-culture-related topics, like smart drinks
  Rave-related stories on local TV stations or newspapers.
  Personal introductions/socializing, *to a degree.* (<---key words)

<snip>

3) SFRaves is *not* a paging service, nor is it a "chat line" for
one-sentence messages.  If you want to just "chat", check out VRave,
at <telnet://hyperreal.com:7283/>.  SFRaves is also not a group
therapy support line - but thoughtful posts about how you have been
affected by rave culture are appropriate, because after all raving is
a very personal experience.
4) The *occasional*(<---another key word) humorous post or
not-entirely-rave-related topic is
fine, but please prefix it with the letters "NRR" in the subject line,
so people who don't want to see that can filter it out.  I.e.
Subject: NRR: a joke..."

I don't mind the occasional NRR posts, in fact there are some really good
NRR posts that I have read and been glad to get, but it just gets out of
hand most of the time. And I think that is what the focus here is. I don't
think people are *truly* against the NRR post (I know I am not), it's just
that there is so much of it all the time and so many truly irrelevant and
thoughtless posts, that people get very bitter about *any* post that isn't
"rave related" whether it be something that may be interesting to them or
not. I feel the same way. Even this thread is getting out of hand and
unfortunately, I felt it necessary to contribute, so please accept my
apologies. But can we stop this now? I hate getting sucked into this stuff.

How's this for a thread?... Rave Campouts... best?... worst?... what you
think of the idea of having such a technological experience in the middle
of a vast forest, where usually one should be "back to the basics?" How has
it enhanced your experience being outdoors for a few days? (try to keep it
sober experiences... those are usually the best IMHO)... discuss...

jenn

//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\//\\

 out of men." -Ella Wheeler Wilcox

At 11:18 AM 6/3/97 -0700, just.jer wrote:
>Sorry for posting this to the list, but I want to know other peoples
>opinions on this. I think the NRR's are sometimes really cool.... and I
>enjoy the variety or different types of messages on here rather than
>ABSOLUTELY everything having to do with raves.... like many people have
>said before.... thing about the rave scene is it's diversity and
>differences... I like the NRR's.... they sometimes show what other
>people are interested in, or interest other people. 

<snip>
[THIS IS NOT MENT AS A FLAME, THINK HAPPY THOUGHTS WHILE READING]
There's a big difference between a few well written NRR posts a day, and
clogging peoples mail boxes with whatever pops into your head.  When I
first joined the list, there were much more thoughtful, informative posts
and a lot less useless "look at me! i've got a 'net connection and I know
how to use it" posts.

I don't mind when someone says "hey peoples, this is neat and I thought I
would share it with you."  But when people post 4 times a day, and all they
can come up with are a bunch of 3 line messages stating how dope there
friends are, or they post 31k worth of SPAM chain mails, that's
inconsiderate.  It's one thing to congratulate a promoter on an excellent
party, it's quite another one person to use THREE separate posts to tell
the promoter it's all right the music was turned off.  

I like reading some NRR stuff too, I really miss Boomerangs stories nstuff.
 But try to keep in mind that some of us are at work and don't have time to
wade through 100 messages looking for the 30 or so that fall under the list
guidelines.  

Brian B. created this list for us to discuss all things vaguely rave
related.  Why do we continue to repay him by blatantly ignoring his
guidelines?

---Chrisp

Ok...its time to put the art party together.

Thank you for all of the response...we have at least 40 people
interested in this and even tho my original intention was
to have small private gatherings this looks like it is going to evolve
into something much bigger...i have even had dj's offer to spin
at these.

So what we want to do is have gatherings to listen to some music
either live or from cd, have some good food...maybe pizza
or a cook out and create various art projects.

These will be paintings, sculptures of fluorescent dolphins, butterflies
aliens, UFO (ultimate friendship objects), altars, geometric sacred
shapes
and anything else we dream up. Perhaps even slide and video shows
if we can get the equipment.

This is basically art for ourselves but if we come up with some really
good
stuff we will offer it to be used at various partys.

These are partys to socialize, enjoy each others company
and to focus the energy of the party on creativity and art.
A mini-renaisance perhaps?

I want to do three groups, one in san francisco , one in 
the east bay, an one in the south bay so it will be
convenient for all and maybe a huge gathering of everyone
occasionally

These will be monthly perhaps weekly partys depending on the level
of interest.

So i want to have an initial meeting to meet everyone and make more
specific plans

Any one interested please email me (off list) and tell me where you live
and what day and time is good for you. I want the first meeting to be 
with in the next two weeks.

Also if anyone has space they would like to let us use for the initial
meeting
or the partys let me know

Please be thinking of what you would like to create.

This will be open to all who want to participate...you don't have to be 
a great artist to join in although it sounds like we have some pretty
talented people.
So even if think you have zero artistic talent you are still
welcome...you just 
might find you have a hidden talent.

have a wonderful day

foolish fish
><{{{">  <"}}}><

hey y'all

sorry if i this message got around to those with BSP filters.

n e wayz, i just picked up a dope ass CD today, Logical Progression Level 2
from the bad boyz at
Good Looking records.  this bombass CD is a 2 disc set featuring artists
from Good Looking such as:
LTJ Bukem, Blame, MC Conrad, MC DRS, Tayla, Artemis, Seba, and Intense.  CD
one is mixed by Blame
with vocals by MC Conrad and MC DRS, and CD two is unmixed.  Blame spins a
seamless set on CD one.
i haven't listened to CD two yet.  but anything from Good Looking is
definitely phat ass.  for all the followers
of Logical Progression and Good Looking, this is a must have.

latez,
d0u8l3 J;)

Hopefully this'll get filtered out too :)

As Jenn and a few others have said, it's not that I or others think that
chatty warm-fuzzies shouldn't be posted to the list, just that sometimes
they get a little bit much.  Since I turned off moderation I think the
level of NRR stuff has been a little high but okay, with the exception of
the chain letters which got forwarded (by someone not even on the list,
actually) - chain letters are just plain trouble, and the person who
posted it didn't even mark it NRR or edit out the hundreds of lines of
mail headers.  Oy. 

I've gotten some good feedback on the guidelines I posted, and everyone
has been pretty positive about it, so I've installed it as the new welcome
message.  Please read it if you haven't yet.  I will set up something to
send a pointer to it every week or so to this list.

I do indeed want this to be a social list, where people can express
themselves and meet others and plan to hook up at parties and such.  

	Brian

--=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=--
brian@hyperreal.com     http://www.apache.org     http://www.organic.com/jobs

night, so I want to go out Friday night to celebrate.  But since I gotta wake 
up so early and I'll be out so late the next day, I have to keep it local.  So 
does anyone know about anything going on in Sacramento (or somewhere around 
here) this Friday?  Preferably not a club, but if it is, it can't be one of 
those 21+ places because my friends and I are kind of underage.

Help please!  Peace be to all the Sacramento ravers, who refuse (sometimes) to 
commute to the bay to get down!

xoxo--Miccaela
ethnicnewbieravergrrl

Come Correct once again.. Johnsin.. here..

Some comps you should check out on CD..

Origin Unknown presents: The Speed of Sound - RAM Records
This set of tunes has been long awaited.. Many of the tracks have been
getting caned by Hype and Andy C for couple of months while they were still
on plates.  Unbelievable tunes for Andy C and many other RAM recording
Artists.  They brought you "Valley of the Shadows" (31 Seconds) back in
'93.. Must get this one.  Dark rolling hardstep for your ears..

Grooverider presents: The Prototype Years - Prototype
Longtime grandfather of Drum n Bass takes a break from his sets at the
Metalheadz night at the Blue Note to bring you this epic collection of
techstep and other dark tunes.  Artist featured are Dillinja's
"Silverblade", previously featured on Metalheadz, the one like the Optical.
The new kid on the block Boymerang with the unbelievable tune "Still" that
has been tearing up the floors of London for sometime, and many more from
Grooverider himself.

Also recommended:
Blame Presents: Logical Progression 2 - Good Looking Records
Platinum Breaks - Metalheadz
Torque - No U-Turn Records
Artcore 3 - React

Take care.. johnsin
massive magazine #17 in SF this week.. peace

ahh, john lee and i once again agree... (ohmygod, what's goin' on? ;^)

brian has done a great job screening posts to bring us back to reality a
bit.... and now has opened the door again for self-moderation ... and ..

it is OUR responsibility to keep the appropriate things on sfraves ....
sometimes that means giving your special favorite funny little post you want
to share a second thought ... then a third thought..  because maybe it's NOT
really appropriate for sending to 500 people whose priority is to share info
on raving and related topics...

because, as much as we may like you .... getting chain letters of *any* sort
on a list like this has no redeeming value .... and poems, as john says,
unless they are about raving per se, are also probably better off in a
different forum.

and for some of you ....I would suggest that, for those who love to shout
out their warm fuzzy feelings to their friends ... how about creating your
own small distribution lists, then you can make sure that your friends get
your happy posts (because they're the ones who care the most) .... and the
other 490 people on the list will thank you for it...

to me, it's not just if it's rave related ... it's even more importantly if
it's of interest to a large number of the many people on this list....  i'm
cool if it's NRR, but it's a little frustrating to weed through the "hi!
it's a wonderful day!" posts and their multitudes of replies when i'm trying
to be efficient scanning to keep track of what's going on ...

ok?  much love, leslie

>about warm and fuzzy feelings w/o mention of beat one, should be relegated
>to alt.poetry.
