DEAR SF RAVES
      It was Mission Impossible only this time it wasnt starring Tom Cruise,
it starred the entire Sf UG scene. THe decorations were beautiful, the vibe
was flowing, the people were smiling, and the masses came out in support of
 Wonderland. The music was just starting really get started, and the police
roll on in. A noise complaint, they say, a bull excuse i say. THe music had
not crept on to the streets that night. Andy, along w/ some times too many
others attempted to convince the police to allow the party to continue. This
mission was impossible, however the SF police Dpt. had already made there
mind up the party would not continue at the dance studio. 
          Now here is where our next mission would start, the party must
continue. Only where would we go, what dj's would follow us to an outdoor
spot. THe decision was made in census, not by the wondercrew but more by the
kids at the party. Before the system arrived, we rather i say they were
dancing in the street to someones car stereo. I at that time was making
several trips back and forth to 24th and mission, and the beach. 
          To make a story shorter, cuz i feel myself rambling. The system did
arrive. Li's set was wicked, yet interupted by the generator running out of
gas, and then me braking it. ( iguess i dont know my own strength) Then the
other Jeremy, Magyvers the generator with a piece of plastic. The Music is
back up, Li starts back up where he left off. Following Li, Micron's set was
amazing as usual( DAn This Doesnt mean you can get a swelled head or
anything). I swear he just messes with our heads, as we shake our booty's to
his set. Just as he finished off his set, the police roll up and the music
goes kupput. Damn it, i swear ill never get to hear Macadio spin live. All
together MISSION COMPLETE. I HaD A BLAST.  MUCh Love to da WonderCRew.

Love~
Jeremy


This was a WonderCrew Production
Written by Jeremy Bispo
Directed by Andy Perez
Starring the SF UG Scene
Nominated For A Acadamy Award~ Just Jer for Playing Macgyver
Also Nominated~HugPaula for playing Alice Frome Da Brady Bunch For cleaning
up
A Special award to the DJ's for following us crazy kids out side

From: Chris <lsavage@uclink4.berkeley.edu>
Subject: happy me
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

        I am incredibly happy again. I just got finished spinning at my
first rave ever. It was quite simply, incredible, and I really like spinning
about one million times more than I did when I woke up this morning. I had
to spin first, so there were only like, 30 people dancing but that's 30 more
people than I'm used to. I just can't describe the feeling to someone else
who hasn't experienced it, because it doesn't even make sense to me why
playing your records feels great. But when those dancers locked into the
groove I was trying to establish(quick hardstep with really wacky
basslines)it all came together. When the dancers cheered by the time I got
to my third track I couldn't believe it. Afterwards I was able to 'hang out'
with other DJ's who I didn't talk to much because I was still recovering
from my hour of spinning. Sorry guys.

        I also had many people tell me they thought I was a stoner, because
I was smoking pot the entire time I was spinning. Okay, so I am a stoner,
okay? That's what summer has done to me. I cheer in delight when I go to
sleep after only smoking out 2 times that day. Usually I can't count the
times I smoke out in a day, but I can count the times I was sober in the day.

        Well, that was a weird little aside. Okay, beautiful SFRavers! Us
Berkeley DJ's are finally coming together as a cohesive unit.(Well, we got
turntables and suddenly the Berkeley DJ's came out in full force.) Thanks to
Kraig, Kenni, and DJ Flite for showing me how to spin. I really can't get
enough of it now.

        -chris(I still haven't thought of a stupid DJ nickname, which I need
because chris sucks)

To: sfraves <sfraves@hyperreal.com>
Subject: The Real Wonderland Story! READ THIS! it's funny =)
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

ok guys... check this out..... here's the story... oh man oh man!

First it starts off like this... friday night Andy from wonder and I
head up to the Dance Studio to hang some lighting.... after almost
getting killed by an IntelliBeam, we go to look for the video projector
which came up stolen! (byebye $6000) =(.

And that's just the beginning to a never ending fight! We head on back
to SJ to finish banners and crap and la dee da. The next day (Saturday)
we finish up, pack up, and move on out. We set up the dance studio which
looked fucking amazing. I really mean that. oh yeah.... and ummm Vlad
and AndyW's sets were fucking insane! I didn't get to hear the chill
room cause I was working the lights, but I hear that was farking RAD
too! =) but wait.... what's this..... the lights turn on... but I didn't
turn them on! WTF? I ran over to the front to find out that there are
cops down stairs. Pooie on us! after Andy dealt with the Police for
about an hour, we decided to tell everyone to go to 24th and Illonois.
As people are walking out, we told everyone to go to 24th and Illonois,
but we find out after having told about 100 people to go there, that
it's gated off now. So we told people to go to 3com! so I shoot over to
24th and Illonois to tell everyone to go to 3com. Man there were a shit
load of people there. There I found no gate and it was totally open! so
I called the Wonder crew up and tell them change of plans! EVERYONE come
to 24th and Illonois. Problem again.... we couldn't change the 415 VM
cause it could only be changed from Andy's cell phone which was dead and
there wasn't a charger, but about 150-200 people show up at 24th and
Illonois anyways =) YAY! we're partying again! Finally we get sound
going and man are people having a fuckin' BLAST! it was insane.... I've
never seen a vibe like that! Weeee Li's rockin' us!!! WOW. POOF
generator dies.... no gas, no gas can. Happily Mike takes off to get gas
and Pablo, Beth, and I find fire =) Mike comes back, puts gas in. We get
a fire goin', the other Jeremy pulls the cord on the generator, and BAM!
Broken. Not the string, oh no that would of been too easy, the wheel
inside snapped in half! the crew starts to pack up! I SAY
"NO!!!!!!!!!!!!" we musn't let this die. I tell Aaron to tell the crew
to stop! Aaron tells them "Guys... put it back together, Jeremy will
make it work!" they say, "Otay!". I scurry around to find something to
fix the generator... I find a worn piece of plastic and hope! I run over
to the generator, and they said it wouldn't work, but I tied that wheel
back together, and gave it a pull.... it didn't work.. =( Another dood
gave it a pull.... slowly.... and HOLY FARKING SHIT! it worked.... The
crowd goes absolutely INSANE! the music is jammin' again! Micron come on
and TEARS IT UP!!!!..... I'm going crazy.. I can't believe these people!
I loved them all! I was bouncing everywhere... then a girl comes up and
asks me to take her to get something to eat, and she offered to get me
something, but I was so happy... I said nah... I'll take you anyways....
it turned out that we both decided to buy food for everyone! we hurry
back to find that the cops got us again! =( pooie. but there were about
15-20 people STILL hanging out! oh man... I love this scene.... we chomp
down those donuts and chit-chat... and then we decide to pack up and
skidaddle... 12 people we gonna go to tallPaul's house, but didn't have
a ride, so Andy was gonna run over to the dance studio and drop off the
speakers and come back After about an hour he never showed, so I called
him up and he said he couldn't leave, so I ran back to get the station
waggon and pick these happy people up. I get there about 45 mins later,
pick 'em up, head on down to paul's house and run outta gas! oh boy =)
more bad stuff! wow. so we send 4 people to find gas and the rest of us
pushed the car hehe. after about another hour and a half we finally get
gas and head over to paul's to drop everyone off. me and a few other
head back to the dance studio and finish packing up. we ended up having
to leave the rented lighting equipment and Andy's speakers there cause
we ran outta room. I head back to SJ after dropping people off, but I
couldn't make it, so I went home to fremont and slept till 9:30pm. When
I woke up, I called andy to let him know I was comming to drop off his
stuff, he informs me of MORE bad news... holy shit! more?!?!? yes more!
hehe "The dance studio told me a drum machine got stolen from their
computer room and they won't give me my speakers and rented lights back
until I replace it", "WTF!!!!?!?!?@$?" I say.... and then I laugh again,
more bad stuff.... well that's all folks... kinda, but man what an
adventure! I loved it and I love the scene.... this is what makes the UG
scene so special.... ABSOLUTELY everything that could have gone wrong,
went wrong with the Wonder crew, but we stuck together and pulled off
something really special. it was truely amazing! Now that the Wonder
crew has gone through everything that they could have in their first
party.... be ready for something super kick ass in the future! =)

on a couple of different notes....Tony, I didn't make the donuts hehe we
bought 'em, Christine... the gas cans... one belonged to my friend mike,
and the other one was purchased by him... he took one back with him and
I ended up with the other somehow.

and last but DEFINATELY NOT least.... what the fuck is up with the Dance
Studio those fucking greedy bastards. Check this out. Friday night the
Wonder crew gets charged another $100 for leaving a ladder up. After the
party they told Andy he wouldn't get his $500 deposit back because there
was a piece of gum stuck in the carpet. They also charged him an extra
$100 for being there an hour too late. Then they tell him that he can't
view the video tape durring the time the $6000 projector got stolen.
Then they tell him that they're keeping his rented stuff which he now
has to pay late fees on. What the hell is up with them, this is absolute
bullshit! first off, why would they have a problem with him seeing the
video tape when the projector got stolen, would andy end up seeing dance
studio staff taking it??? what are they hiding there.... $500 for gum?
$100 for a ladder? $100 an hour too late???? Did they just tell andy
that the drum machine got stolen, when in fact it didn't! It definately
wasn't his fault! he can't lock the doors to the computer room nor can
he unlock them! no one could have gotten in there with out the Wonder
crew noticing! I this there is something seriously fucked going on here!

well I had an AWESOME time! I love all of you! have a great day! I need
to go home and get sleep...

                                        .just jer.
                                       -@spire-

ps. @spire's first party is comming up July 12th... get ready for
another something special! =)

In a message dated 97-06-23 04:48:53 EDT, vision@mpath.com (Max Vision)
writes:

<< It's extremely unlikely that the bust was for "raving".  The constitution
 has been limited in other ways - "peaceful assembly" has _numbers_
 attached to it nowadays, and especially for commercial events, there are
 county, city, and state laws regarding venue capacity, insurance, and fire
 codes.  Some parties we have even had to hire Seattle police to work the
 door or they would have busted the party (even though we did buy
 insurance, and did pass fire code - and yes the inspector managed to make
 it to almost every rave venue and he always collected his little fee)...
 Also, I wasn't at wonderland so I don't know what when down exactly, but
 sometimes things like noise reports, drive by seeing 30 kids on a sidewalk
 most of whom are 12, anonymous phone calls from the vast array of narcs
 that for some reason call police about everything for whatever their
 whacked in the head motives are, etc etc etc.
 
   Things happen, but I really can't agree that someone is cracking down on
 "raving" just to stop fun.  If a cop or group of cops are looking to bust
 something, odds are they aren't looking at the party, but they are there
 for the conditions (fire permits and sh*t) following up from a report of
 noise level, drugs, underage kids, permits, etc.  I think it's a
 perspective thing.  I'd like to say I'd rather police never came to raves
 or paid attention, but you know what, I'd be awefully *glad* they were
 around if I saw a fellow raver overdose or get seriously hurt or (forbid)
 there actually ever was a fire at a show (anyone ever see a fire at a
 rave?) you know what I mean?  Same thing with door security at big
 parties, they seem to suck, but overall it makes sense that they pat for
 weapons, and take markers...
 
 hope i didn't just open myself for mass flame damage,
 love,
 Max >>


Salutations,

Well, I'm going to have to agree with Max! I have to admit that I was
slightly angry about Wonderland getting busted and all, but all good things
must come to a stop at some point or even a pause. I guess I just spoke
before thought. My bad. Sorry! Allz good!!!!!!!! =c) I at least had a good
time in the time it was running so I can't complain. 

I'm outtie

*~*StArDuSt*~*

you think THAT was a mission impossible?
well here's how our mission went.
showed up @ wonderland @ 2 (my car's battery died andamanda insisted in 
drivign down from SF to pick me up)
and the po are already there. we wait around to get in and get some of 
amanda's christmas lites down..
ask various members of the wonder kru where to go and they tell us
"THE PARK BEHIND 3COM PARK! *NOT* 24th AND MISSION!"
humm, we think, never been to THIS park.
so we drive to 3com park, and stand around in the wind/sit around in our 
cars (there are about 8 cars here) waiting for about a half hour for the 
sound sstem to show up.
po decides to roll. cars scatter, we end up at a house in SJ with JEPH 
spinning for us on decks with no pitch control and stuff like that.
page various friends, trying to find out what happened to Wonder.
around 10 am aaron calls me back and says "oh yea the party went OFF @ 
24th and Illinois!"

so.
it was a mission so impossible it didn't happen for us.
my question is: 3com park... WHAT THE FUCK?
:)
not to be a bitch, next time find a spot.. and stick WITH it.

---------- Forwarded message ----------

from mtv news online:


APHEX TWIN TO LAUNCH BIG TOP TOUR

After several attempts to bring some sort of roving electronic festival tour
to the highways and byways of America, someone has finally done it.

Moby, Aphex Twin, B.T., Banco De Gaia, and LTJ Bukem will be on hand when the
Big Top tour begins making its rounds on August 27 in Detroit, Michigan.
 Logical Progression, Loop Guru, 808 State, Nico, and many others will be
joined by local DJs at each of the tour's ten stops before things wind up in
Los Angeles on September 13.

Here's where Big Top will be pitching its tents this summer:


8/27 - Detroit, MI @ Pine Knob
8/30 - Washington, D.C. @ Nissan Amphitheater
8/31 - Asbury Park, NJ @ Atlantic Park
9/1 - Boston, MA @ Great Woods
9/3 - Rochester, NY Fingerlakes Amphitheater
9/5 - Atlanta, GA @ Lakewood Amphitheater
9/6 - Orlando, FL @ Central Florida Fairgrounds
9/9 - Dallas, TX @ Starplex
9/12 - San Francisco, CA @ Shoreline Amphitheater
9/13 - Los Angeles, CA @ Snow Valley


"Who is there that, in logical words, can express the effect music has
 on us?  A kind of inarticulate, unfathomable speech, which leads us to
 the edge of the infinite and lets us for moments gaze into that!"

						-Thomas Carlyle

just.jer wrote:
> 
> ok guys... check this out..... here's the story... oh man oh man!
> 
> First it starts off like this... friday night Andy from wonder and I
> head up to the Dance Studio to hang some lighting.... after almost
> getting killed by an IntelliBeam, we go to look for the video projector
> which came up stolen! (byebye $6000) =(.
> 
> And that's just the beginning to a never ending fight! We head on back
> to SJ to finish banners and crap and la dee da. The next day (Saturday)
> we finish up, pack up, and move on out. We set up the dance studio which
> looked fucking amazing. I really mean that. oh yeah.... and ummm Vlad
> and AndyW's sets were fucking insane! I didn't get to hear the chill
> room cause I was working the lights, but I hear that was farking RAD
> too! =) but wait.... what's this..... the lights turn on... but I didn't
> turn them on! WTF? I ran over to the front to find out that there are
> cops down stairs. Pooie on us! after Andy dealt with the Police for
> about an hour, we decided to tell everyone to go to 24th and Illonois.
> As people are walking out, we told everyone to go to 24th and Illonois,
> but we find out after having told about 100 people to go there, that
> it's gated off now. So we told people to go to 3com! so I shoot over to
> 24th and Illonois to tell everyone to go to 3com. Man there were a shit
> load of people there. There I found no gate and it was totally open! so
> I called the Wonder crew up and tell them change of plans! EVERYONE come
> to 24th and Illonois. Problem again.... we couldn't change the 415 VM
> cause it could only be changed from Andy's cell phone which was dead and
> there wasn't a charger, but about 150-200 people show up at 24th and
> Illonois anyways =) YAY! we're partying again! Finally we get sound
> going and man are people having a fuckin' BLAST! it was insane.... I've
> never seen a vibe like that! Weeee Li's rockin' us!!! WOW. POOF
> generator dies.... no gas, no gas can. Happily Mike takes off to get gas
> and Pablo, Beth, and I find fire =) Mike comes back, puts gas in. We get
> a fire goin', the other Jeremy pulls the cord on the generator, and BAM!
> Broken. Not the string, oh no that would of been too easy, the wheel
> inside snapped in half! the crew starts to pack up! I SAY
> "NO!!!!!!!!!!!!" we musn't let this die. I tell Aaron to tell the crew
> to stop! Aaron tells them "Guys... put it back together, Jeremy will
> make it work!" they say, "Otay!". I scurry around to find something to
> fix the generator... I find a worn piece of plastic and hope! I run over
> to the generator, and they said it wouldn't work, but I tied that wheel
> back together, and gave it a pull.... it didn't work.. =( Another dood
> gave it a pull.... slowly.... and HOLY FARKING SHIT! it worked.... The
> crowd goes absolutely INSANE! the music is jammin' again! Micron come on
> and TEARS IT UP!!!!..... I'm going crazy.. I can't believe these people!
> I loved them all! I was bouncing everywhere... then a girl comes up and
> asks me to take her to get something to eat, and she offered to get me
> something, but I was so happy... I said nah... I'll take you anyways....
> it turned out that we both decided to buy food for everyone! we hurry
> back to find that the cops got us again! =( pooie. but there were about
> 15-20 people STILL hanging out! oh man... I love this scene.... we chomp
> down those donuts and chit-chat... and then we decide to pack up and
> skidaddle... 12 people we gonna go to tallPaul's house, but didn't have
> a ride, so Andy was gonna run over to the dance studio and drop off the
> speakers and come back After about an hour he never showed, so I called
> him up and he said he couldn't leave, so I ran back to get the station
> waggon and pick these happy people up. I get there about 45 mins later,
> pick 'em up, head on down to paul's house and run outta gas! oh boy =)
> more bad stuff! wow. so we send 4 people to find gas and the rest of us
> pushed the car hehe. after about another hour and a half we finally get
> gas and head over to paul's to drop everyone off. me and a few other
> head back to the dance studio and finish packing up. we ended up having
> to leave the rented lighting equipment and Andy's speakers there cause
> we ran outta room. I head back to SJ after dropping people off, but I
> couldn't make it, so I went home to fremont and slept till 9:30pm. When
> I woke up, I called andy to let him know I was comming to drop off his
> stuff, he informs me of MORE bad news... holy shit! more?!?!? yes more!
> hehe "The dance studio told me a drum machine got stolen from their
> computer room and they won't give me my speakers and rented lights back
> until I replace it", "WTF!!!!?!?!?@$?" I say.... and then I laugh again,
> more bad stuff.... well that's all folks... kinda, but man what an
> adventure! I loved it and I love the scene.... this is what makes the UG
> scene so special.... ABSOLUTELY everything that could have gone wrong,
> went wrong with the Wonder crew, but we stuck together and pulled off
> something really special. it was truely amazing! Now that the Wonder
> crew has gone through everything that they could have in their first
> party.... be ready for something super kick ass in the future! =)
> 
> on a couple of different notes....Tony, I didn't make the donuts hehe we
> bought 'em, Christine... the gas cans... one belonged to my friend mike,
> and the other one was purchased by him... he took one back with him and
> I ended up with the other somehow.
> 
> and last but DEFINATELY NOT least.... what the fuck is up with the Dance
> Studio those fucking greedy bastards. Check this out. Friday night the
> Wonder crew gets charged another $100 for leaving a ladder up. After the
> party they told Andy he wouldn't get his $500 deposit back because there
> was a piece of gum stuck in the carpet. They also charged him an extra
> $100 for being there an hour too late. Then they tell him that he can't
> view the video tape durring the time the $6000 projector got stolen.
> Then they tell him that they're keeping his rented stuff which he now
> has to pay late fees on. What the hell is up with them, this is absolute
> bullshit! first off, why would they have a problem with him seeing the
> video tape when the projector got stolen, would andy end up seeing dance
> studio staff taking it??? what are they hiding there.... $500 for gum?
> $100 for a ladder? $100 an hour too late???? Did they just tell andy
> that the drum machine got stolen, when in fact it didn't! It definately
> wasn't his fault! he can't lock the doors to the computer room nor can
> he unlock them! no one could have gotten in there with out the Wonder
> crew noticing! I this there is something seriously fucked going on here!
> 
> well I had an AWESOME time! I love all of you! have a great day! I need
> to go home and get sleep...
> 
>                                         .just jer.
>                                        -@spire-
> 
> ps. @spire's first party is comming up July 12th... get ready for
> another something special! =)

permit like the one that the light seed crew has. A special religion
permit and they are the only ones that have one to my knowledge.  Im
sure Jeff and you E.menon are kewl and you guys go to a lot of parties
and show support but you have never done a party I assume or you would

From: Dan Capriles <micron1@rocketmail.com>
Subject: wonderland and the dance studio
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

first of all i would like to say THANK U TO ANDY P> and the WHOLE
CREW!!

this was probably the strangest and most challenging night that i have
ever had.

but first:
the ppl. over at the dance studio are getting WAY to GREEDY and need
to be shown that we WILL NOT support this type of attitude.  their
prices have been going up steadily as the demand for the studio has
gone up AND they know that they are now a "known" location with no
guarantee of not gettting busted.  but what pisses me off is that they
would make andy pay for a drum machine that was in a LOCKED room, by
renting out the space THEY are accepting responsibilty for their own
equipment.  It is their responsibility to make sure that what they
consider valuable is locked away in a secure space.  AND...i won't
even go into how i feel about them charging andy for the ladder and
gum (though i don't know enough about the gum situation to really make
an educated stand on this matter).  I mean..the gum should be cleaned
up.....

anyways...back to the party:
CRAZY/STRANGE/INCREDIBLE...is how i describe it.

here is a condensed version of the craziness:
1: map point get's all screwed up (faster bamboo was supposed to do
it), so we do it at my house.
2: directions to map point get screwed up (wrong v.m. #)
3: get to the party (very excited about spinning) hang out...the cops
show.
4: after about a half hour a sitting there they kick everyone out.
5: after party-3com or the "other spot"???
6: drive by 3-com only to encounter some not-so-friendly types.
7: get a page...go to "other spot"...UGH!!!!
8: get there....ppl. are going of to a car stereo..like
100+..crazy...but way cool.
9.  sound and genny FINALLY get there, set up, start jamming...Li
busts out the first set. nice techno to start off the morning (sun is
coming up by now)
10.  WHAM genny runs out of gas (wait 30 min. more while someone goes
to get some)....WHAM again...the genny breaks...jeremy fixes it and we
start up again...SHEESH
11.  i FINALLY get to spin..YEAH....about 15 min. into it someone
points out a cop car to me...NOW WHAT??  i truly think this night was
meant as a test of everyone's will power......about 5 min. later 2
cars show up and that's IT!  (well...atleast i got to play for like 20
min. hey macadio..don't worry you'll play first at the next
party..even if it's the 9:30-11 time slot.  ;)
12. we pack up and jeremy shows up with like 3 dozen donuts (u guys
kick ASS!) man by then i could use the sugar.
13. we pack up the sound and leave......i'm ever soo tired and hardly
got to spin and drove around/waited for most the night....but i STILL
had a blast.

THANKS TO EVERYONE who made it out....u guys showed me something that
i haven't seen in a while.......

a desire to be there and create your own vibe/destiny and NOT bitch
and complain the whole time.....

thank you....
micron

>At 01:33 PM 6/22/97 -0700, you wrote:

>>too?

>>happens right?

>>Cops are out to up-hold the law. It's not there fault if the promoters
>>don't follow big brothers rules.
>
>        The guys who threw wonderland assured us that they had a permit and
>the cops would soon be on their way. Unfortunately because of other people
>outside trying to get in while the cops were out front didn't help matters
>at all.

SF doesn't give permits for that type of party without very rare special
exception. That's why virtually all legal events are in Oakland. (where
they've now decided to limit permits to one per night due to all the shit
they've had to deal with)

The problem with SF is that there seem to be few viable locations (or
people don't have the time to look for new ones) and obviously the police
and, perhaps more impotantly, the neighbors, know what's going on. If they
get a noise complaint they'll be more prone to act on it if it's happening
every week.

Hmm, what the hack ever happened to SFRL?

Joe

Subject: Wonderland + Rant
In-Reply-To: <970623064432_-294029310@emout11.mail.aol.com>
Message-ID: <Pine.GSO.3.95.970623100813.27422A-100000@atari>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk


I'm going to have to disagree with anybody blindly assuming the police are
always in line when busting parties however.  Often, they break a party up
without processing any arrests or paperwork (citations, violations, 
whatever) because they were not within the law when breaking up the party.  

You see, back when I was young, we had these things called rights...

Permits are good and permits are nice, but it's nieve to believe that
permits are either cheap or reasonable.  Often, they include clauses
indicating what security should be used, or will allow for police
guidelines, like mandating that at least half of the on duty force be paid
police officers (who aren't cheap by any standards).  They also usually
require multiple walk throughs by police and fire personnel,
liability insurance (for those of you who like to sue when things go wrong
as they sometimes do), and a whole buncha other good stuff, which is often
impractical or impossible on relatively short notice.  All these things
cost money.  I was involved in a permitted party a while back, and it was
VERY pricey and a full time job for those throwing it to pull off.

It's tough to break even on a small permitted party, so expect to see more
small unpermitted parties.  Hell, if the police keep breaking up our more
'regular' venues, expect to see some full blown bolt cutter renegades.

The harder they make it to throw one, the harder we go off when we have
one.  The harder we go off, the more hardcore we get, and the less we
will stop at to get there again.  

Repetitive beats... repetitive beats...

I should hope the majority of us don't think parties should be about
liability and lawsuits but more an escape from it.  A place about being
real and accepting personal responsibilty for yourself, and taking what
you want, and dancing the way you want, and doing what you want with who
you want.  About getting the whole room to lift a couple inches off the
ground, if even for a second.  Where the only rule is that the needle stay
in the groove, and the only code of behavior is your own mutual respect
extend towards all there regardless of your hangups.  The tribe has
nothing to do with the law.  The tribe is an alternative to the law,
because the law doesn't work for everybody.  The tribe does not select
those who join it, those who join it choose to join the tribe.  It is a
question of free will, and free will alone, and in this place where
anything is possible we find one another, dream a sometimes common dream,
and come back to 'life' monday all the better for it.  

This freedom, this community, it is a great wealth, and we act liked the
most spoiled of children when we discuss it.  We talk about the what
"they" do, about what "they" spin, and often forget that this is a "we"
thing, not a "they" thing.  If you're not willing to take part of the
responsibilty for this, then go buy your massive tickets at BASS and enjoy
your licensed, permitted, secure, policed, bignamedj, 4 billion watt
laser, render you deaf after 2 second sound system with bass to the gills
bouncy castle and fire breathing wannabe disneyland hellhole with the rest
of those see it a little differently.  Actually, that sorta sounds fun
too, but I love small parties, I love the freedom and the freaks and the
chance to get around to meeting everyone.

Or maybe I'm just ranting because I had a few more records to go when they
shut us down Saturday... I dunno.

I'll shut up now...
Andy

p.s.	Hella props to those who kept going, wish I coulda been there.

I was there and there were not two deaths but two stabbing, one person did leave our dimension and has gone on to the next level. The other person has survived from what I understand.

There was a lot of confusion for a little while. With security all over the place searching for the person or persons responacable. The good news ( if there could be any ) is most people at the part had no clue this had happened. This includes myself, I did notice cops and security and an old man wondering around for a while searching for something. When finally some one told me what had transpired, I ran into Tom one of the promoters and told him how sorry I was that this went down at his party, he told me he was upset about and some other things I care not to repeat.  

All in all after looking and watching for a little while I have this to say.

I have been raving well over ten years now, I came out here from NY City and have some deep roots in the scene. I am now 28 going on 29, I have seen gangs my whole life ( never joined one ), I do know and understand what gangs offer some people on the streets.

Point is this, keep your gang related SHIT on the street where it belongs, kill each other on the street! ( you should really try acting like a MAN and use your fist, but that is anther whole topic ) When you come to a rave, your COLORS and DISPUTES need to stay at the door. Inside the Rave or Party we are all there for one thing and that is to enjoy the music and each others company while hopefully achieving some better understanding of each other. If you can not do this you should not FUCKING GO! 

I hear a lot of people talk about east coast and west coast, FUCK THAT, you live in the STATES or you do NOT, I personally do not listen to anything that tells me to go out and whack some one period. That message will not make me a better person it will only help me become a thug! I choose to help uplift the human spirit and treat my fellow Brother and Sister ( White, Black, Red, Yellow, Purple, Green , etc.. ) with some sort of respect and understanding. Trust me I have made my share of mistakes in my life, I always try and walk away learning something.

Get a grip, if your life goal is to roll around in a Benz or a Porch by the age of 17 or 20, and you achieved this by hurting a fellow human being , you my friend are PART of THE PROBLEM on this planet. 

I have little 6 year old girl, and personally if some one killed her because she got caught in a crossfire from some gang related bullshit, I would be one raging mother fucker.

Try this . Close your Eyes, picture yourself with a child ( son or daughter ) now picture your child getting caught in something they had nothing to do with because of some punks wish and desire to be rich or have juice or power or to be so called COOL.
Now how do you feel, if you feel nothing you have some soul searching to do.

Remember you will grow older, your views will natural change, you will probably end with children, what type of state do you want to leave them in?

To be COOL, you do not have to do stupid shit to prove something to your friends, if you need to do this for them, I would question who I hang out with. To be REALLY COOL try making your Fucking Neighbor Hoods look better, try helping an Old Lady Cross a street, Try talking with a Truly homeless person an offer them help. 

We all get mad an upset, take a breath punch your brick wall ( I do ) and then re think it! Is a life worth the actual problem? How would you feel if some was gonna whack you and you did not even know? Or if some one was making fun of you, or raging on you? Is what they are saying true ( if so change it ) if not blow it off and laugh at them for being so damn insecure about themselves and give them a hug. 

Oh well enough preaching, we all know the difference between right and wrong, stop - look - and listen!

Peace for the masses - Pete

i don't think this came through to the list, despite the fact that i wrote
it upwards of 4 days ago.  i was going to let it die in cyberspace, but
after reading monty's post on this subject thought i should resend it.....

At 3:29 PM -0400 6/19/97, Jacksplash@aol.com wrote:
>yeeeaaaaaAAHHHH!, er, uh, sorry....me too!
>but vsf was pretty cool @2-6am...
>
>.now that Funky Techno Tribe crap @ mission rock wasn't much more than what
>you said, buncha ppl trying to *be* something or somewhere, well I didn't
>care for it much.....why is everyone so interested in actually SEEING someone
>spin? they crowded the table, like they've never seen a rekkid b4 or
>something....buncha ppl driving around slowly  in their nice cars in the
>parking lot...ok, I'll stop griping now

just as ravers who might not be into clubs are probably not frequenting the
right clubs, you are imvho not frequenting the right raves if you are
commenting only on an experience at a funky tekno tribe massive.

this imvho is anything but a ug party.  overcommercialized, thrown to put
money into the pocket of the promoter.  not for the right reasons or to
raise awareness and consciousness (both of which tie into that ever
important *vibe*), which are two things i look for in ug parties.

just for fun, check out
http://www.cloudfactory.org/knowledge/askyourself.html.  it sort of ties
into why we do what we do, why we go the places we go, and asks us to
investigate these things within ourselves.  by answering the questions, you
may come to an understanding about why you prefer the things you do.....or
why you don't.

;>

love,
lola

Well this here is going to be my final post on SFRaves for a while.  I
have to leave the list and leave the rave scene at that for a while now. 
I was in class today and I was thinking about the scene in general.  I
thought about the love and the and the common goal to have a killer
party.  Then I started thinking about how it's changed me.  While it has
made me a much more understanding and open minded person, it has also
caused me to slack off in my school work.  I was in psychology today and
I started thinking, "Fuck, I used to be on the Dean's List before I
started raving.  Now I'm sitting here getting a 2.25 (spring semester)
GPA."  I can deny it and say it's not 'cause of raving but the fact is
that this shit didn't happen when I wasn't raving.  As a result, I'm
going to have to go cold turkey and separate myself from this whole thing
until I feel that I'm able to have enough discipline to combine the rave
scene with my schoolwork.  This is college now and you can't do half-ass
work like you can do in high school.

Being on this list has allowed me to meet so many beautiful people. 
First, I would like to give thanks to Christine the Candy Girl (brown
hair) for originally getting me into SFRaves.  It was great knowing you
and I'm sure I'll run into you again some day.  Thanks to Macadio.  The
first DJ I actually ever knew personally.  You're a totally nice guy and
you spin some of the coolest shit.  Keep up the good work man.  Also, to
the many others I have met including Orson, Maggie, Elena, Lara, Dan,
Beth, Pablo (excellent attitude), Mike (or Mark, shit I always forget.)
and more, it's just that I can't remember all the names.

Again, you are all some of the coolest people I've met and I'm sure one
day I'll be able to join you guys again.  Happy Kids is going to be my
last party for a long while then I'm going to vanish.  I'm going to try
and make my exit go with a bang.

I hope you all stay as awesome and I'll see whoever is going to be at
Happy Kids on Friday.  I'll be wearing a blue Hawaiian shirt so I won't
be hard to find.  If you see me, come give me a going away hug and make
me leave this family with a warm feeling.

You all have the highest respects from me.

dErEk

At 10:26 AM 6/23/97, byroni wrote:
>A good friend of mine told me that someone was stabbed and killed at
>Origin.exit Is this true?

true. tho i heard it was 2 ppl; 2 stabbed and 1 killed. hence my foul mood
yesterday. god, i've never heard of anything like this - one, why would you
stab someone in the first place? does this really solve the arguement? and
two - at a _rave_? someone posted earlier that we weren't there hurting
anyone - and most of us aren't. but speak only for yourself, 'coz there are
obviously those out there who get some kind of sick pleasure out of killing
ppl.

>I had a really good feeling about this party 2 weeks ago. But as last week
>began I started to feel really different. I dunno what it was. I had
>planned to go up until Saturday but I decided not to (or actually by
>body did)and I fell asleep on the couch at my new pad in Oaktown. It's sad
>that things like this can happen in what seems to be the most
>loving/understanding setting I know.

funny, i had a really strange feeling about going to this party. but i went
- it was my first sf party... had to check it out. and back to the 'raver v
clubber' thread... i posted that we should all respect ppl's individual
choices, but this kind of shit cannot be respected. people, please, don't
bring weapons to parties. fuck, why do you need them anyway? really, you
can certainly have more fun without them. i have never been so stunned
about anything in my life. except the deaths of friends in the past. this
is outrageous. at a rave. bunch of ppl having a grand old time, right? ha.
plur? what's plur when ppl are killing each other? i think we need to get a
bit more basic here. maybe it hit me so hard because i was under the
influence at the time, but i think i would have reacted the same way if
sober. i couldn't stop thinking about it for the rest of the night (and
then all day yesterday). everywhere i looked, ppl began to look more evil
to me (not all, but some).... granted the argument was a personal one, but
what if some young kid had gotten in the way? obviously these ppl didn't
place any value on life. anyway, i'm rambling, i'm shocked,   i'm just
shocked. far too fucked up for my somewhat peaceful mind to comprehend. i
don't have any answers, only questions. what can be done to prevent this
sort of thing from happening again? you know, i don't even believe in the
death penalty (in that case - far worse to have to live your life in a
restricted cell). life *is* precious. nothing should be solved by death. it
really doesn't solve anything.

>God bless the victim of this. May his/her spirit be free to roam the
>cosmos.

victims. and not just those killed and injured (not to say that that isn't
the most important thing). i think that there were those among us at the
party who felt this very deeply. it really hurts us all, whether we know
the people or not. this sort of thing shouldn't be happening, especially
not among our 'tribe'.

anyway, i'll stop rambling on now.... i really hope that this isn't a sign
of things to come.

_peace_.
e. (not smiling about this one)

one other side comment about the party: men: do not come up and try to
dance on top of me. do not drool at me, do not ask me if i want to dance
with you. please. i'm already dancing, and quite happy that way. i don't
dress provocatively; perhaps those that do enjoy this sort of goggling
(can't imagine why tho). really, and this is where the respect comes in....
we're all there to have fun. respect *that* if nothing else. i'm not
speaking for other women, but i personally don't take this machismo shit.
makes me sick. how could i respect a guy who (one) has no respect for me,
and (two) thinks it's cool to drool over women as if they were starving men
looking at food they couldn't have? how insane.

but aside from the above (and the lack running water) it was a great party!
really. many nice folks. it's just that some things tend to rub me the
wrong way. my problem, i guess.

>I did not see jeff's Original post but I just wanted to touch on the

>FREE PARTY IN THE CITY OF SAN FRANCISCO. Unless you have a special

snip

actually, i have thrown a few parties. so it was in 91.  and i have a good
friend that is a promoter in austin. he always has to get a shit load of
permits, insurance, etc etc. and is always very careful about these things.
i don't think that any of his parties have ever been busted. the only thing
illegal that goes on there is the dealing, and he's never involved in that.
but you're right, i am not familiar with the sf zoning laws, fire codes,
insurance requirements, and so on. so perhaps i spoke too soon. it's just
that in the other places that i know ppl who throw parties, there is always
a lot of red tape that has to be cut through. guess this isn't so here.
weird. but my mistake. anyway, i wasn't 'shooting off' as you so eloquently
put - i was merely stating that _IMO_ if you're going to throw a party, you
should check with city hall, sfpd, or who ever, to find out what exactly
needs to be done. there are so many parties out here, i find it hard to
believe that they are _all_ busted as you wrote. really? _all_ of them?
what the fuck is the point of paying $20 if you know that every party is
going to be busted? and if they aren't _all_ getting busted, obviously some
of them are doing things by the books. i was not 'talking shit'... merely
stating my opinion. and no, i'm not 'k e w l'.

and please, next time you respond to something i wrote, if you're also
responding to the entire list, take my email addy off it. it's so
ridiculous to have to sift through duplicates of everything.

apologies for sounding sour, but i don't care to get flamed, i'm recovering
from the shock of the stabbings, and i think there were judgements here
that were unfounded.

cheers - e.

this, hi jeff:) i think the main problem with flames and posts is that
sometimes people get a bit too ANAL RETENTIVE about stuff. raves
aren't perfect. not everyone is a happy glittery candy raver and even
so, sometimes certain people get irritated by all this "HI!!! want a
sticker??" thing or john s. lee's very very very clear statement about
how PLUR sucks. the idea is wonderful, it just gets really cheesy
sometimes... and sometimes people elaborate their hate towards certain

express the sound of voice and tone through an email! so people take
what someone says too seriously sometimes and that can start a flame
war.

At 11:32 AM 6/23/97, AndyW wrote:
>I'm going to have to disagree with anybody blindly assuming the police are
>always in line when busting parties however.  Often, they break a party up
>without processing any arrests or paperwork (citations, violations,
>whatever) because they were not within the law when breaking up the party.
>
>You see, back when I was young, we had these things called rights...

no, this is what we were _told_. back when i was young, the police got away
with a whole lot more than they do now. (check out any civil rights rallies
from the late '60s and intothe 70s...)
>
>Permits are good and permits are nice, but it's nieve to believe that
>permits are either cheap or reasonable.  Often, they include clauses
>indicating what security should be used, or will allow for police
>guidelines, like mandating that at least half of the on duty force be paid
>police officers (who aren't cheap by any standards).  They also usually
>require multiple walk throughs by police and fire personnel,
>liability insurance (for those of you who like to sue when things go wrong
>as they sometimes do), and a whole buncha other good stuff, which is often
>impractical or impossible on relatively short notice.  All these things
>cost money.  I was involved in a permitted party a while back, and it was
>VERY pricey and a full time job for those throwing it to pull off.

they cost a shit-load. i've heard quotes floating around the $100k mark.
have yet to meet a promoter who actually makes money off his/her
parties....

>It's tough to break even on a small permitted party, so expect to see more
>small unpermitted parties.  Hell, if the police keep breaking up our more
>'regular' venues, expect to see some full blown bolt cutter renegades.

i find all venues fun in different ways. i like the big name djs, as well
as the ug parties, as well as the clubs. it's just that if you're going to
an unpermitted party, be aware of the possible bust. likewise, if you break
the law, chin-up and take responsibility for your actions instead of
whining about it.

>I should hope the majority of us don't think parties should be about
>liability and lawsuits but more an escape from it.  A place about being
>real and accepting personal responsibilty for yourself, and taking what
>you want, and dancing the way you want, and doing what you want with who
>you want.  About getting the whole room to lift a couple inches off the
>ground, if even for a second.  Where the only rule is that the needle stay
>in the groove, and the only code of behavior is your own mutual respect
>extend towards all there regardless of your hangups.  The tribe has
>nothing to do with the law.  The tribe is an alternative to the law,

absolutely. but when it comes down to it, accept the consequences.

>This freedom, this community, it is a great wealth, and we act liked the
>most spoiled of children when we discuss it.  We talk about the what
>"they" do, about what "they" spin, and often forget that this is a "we"
>thing, not a "they" thing.

cheers!
e. :)

At 3:21 PM -0500 6/23/97, e.menon wrote:
>true. tho i heard it was 2 ppl; 2 stabbed and 1 killed. hence my foul mood
>yesterday. god, i've never heard of anything like this - one, why would you
>stab someone in the first place? does this really solve the arguement? and
>two - at a _rave_? someone posted earlier that we weren't there hurting
>anyone - and most of us aren't. but speak only for yourself, 'coz there are
>obviously those out there who get some kind of sick pleasure out of killing
>ppl.

a visit from the paradigm.shifter:

yes, there are people out there who for some reson feel the need to make
their presence in society felt via a mighty hand.  both in the outside
world, and yes, within our own little microcosm as well.  let me rephrase
that:  there are people in the great big world we try to avoid by building
this community that do engage in violent acts, and sometimes they spill
over into our community.  to think that these types of things will not
happen at a "rave" or wherever there is "raver" presence is imo not only
narrow.minded but also pretty foolish.  we may try to escape the horrors of
mainstream society via the community we strive to uphold and nurture, but
we cannot escape the world around us, and to think that we are impermeable
to any negative forces from the outside is a little hasty.  it isn't "us"
and "them".  it's us trying to create a community for us, a community which
strives to absorb as many of "them" as can understand the foundation atop
of which "us" stands.  i do not know why this person resorted to an act of
violence, there are many other ways to reslove a conflict.  i in no way
endorse violent behavior as a means of conflict resolution, but i would
like to comment on how quickly we tend to jump to conclusions about someone
else's actions, although we stand outside of the situation, and can in no
way know all of the reasons behind why that particular action was chosen.
once again, as i said, i am in no way trying to jump to this person's
defense, but for a community that prides itself on understanding, it seems
like there is an awful lot of finger pointing and alienation going on.  and
this is one reaction which does anything but alleviate the problem of
violence.  the more a person who engages in such activity is shunned, the
more he will lash out.  i urge you to be careful of the things that you say
in the heat of a very emotional moment, which i am sure this was and i am
sorry that you had to witness it.  but at the core of harmonious
relationships between fellow human beings is an understanding of the
arbitrary nature of all things.....i could comment for hours on other
things touched upon in this post, but i think this is generally the gist of
what i am trying to say.  i hope it is understandable....

my condolences to all of those touched by this travesty.

love,
lola


   l     o     l     a
        /M\          a         r
       ^ V ^ i r t u a l   D e s i g n e r
_______./_\.______lola@cloudfactory.org_____________

From: Pengo <Pengo@ten.net>

MIME-Version: 1.0
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: F-8 Campout
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

A Kick Ass, Kick Ass, Kick ASS (Did I say Kick Ass?) Weekend!!!

Ben, Iris, Adam M. and Myself got up there around 7-8PM and set up. What
a Bomb site!! Plenty of different areas to set up camp and the garden
was so cool! It's been quite a while since I've gotten spiritual over a
party, but this one really blew my mind. MARS & MYSTR-E both spun 3-4
hour MONSTER SETS that just kicked my ass all over the place. Especially
MARS's final hour & 1/2 which I have to say, was both violent and
beautiful at the same time. Something about it caused me to associate it
with feelings of death. How can this have been good? It was like a
thunder and lightning storm or like a gigantic twister: awsome forces of
nature that have a life of their own and wield incredible power. I swear
at about 5AM I was inside my tent thinking I was going to die! And
then... the music stoped... the sun came out... and it was one of the
most beautiful days I have ever seen. Everyone seemed totaly different,
changed. The garden was so fantasic to chill in. It was as if we had all
died the night before and that this was the afterlife. Heaven. Paridise.
Nothing to do except lounge around, eat fruit, smoke out, talk, kiss,
jump in the hot tub, ect...

Awsome, Awsome, party.

-=Pengo=-

Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

At 4:19 PM 6/23/97, lola*mar wrote:
>a visit from the paradigm.shifter:
>
>yes, there are people out there who for some reson feel the need to make
>their presence in society felt via a mighty hand.  both in the outside
>world, and yes, within our own little microcosm as well.  let me rephrase
>that:  there are people in the great big world we try to avoid by building
>this community that do engage in violent acts, and sometimes they spill
>over into our community.  to think that these types of things will not
>happen at a "rave" or wherever there is "raver" presence is imo not only
>narrow.minded but also pretty foolish.

snip

ahem. i don't think of myself as being narrow-minded. naive, when it comes
to certain things, and optimistic about the potential of this tribe, and
humanity in general. i believe that we all, wrong-doers included, have some
good within us. sometimes tho (and here my education in sociology will
become flamingly apparent) our socialization hides this so well that even
we can't feel it anymore. you know, i have a lot of sympathy for kids who
have to go through so much shit that the only family they can find is
within a gang. this in no way means that i tolerate or accept the way that
they choose to handle conflicts. i think ppl can change, and i'm optimistic
in that way. yes, i'm naive. i grew up in a super-liberal enclave in a
relatively small town in upstate ny, spent some time in a secluded arts
community in phila, and lived in austin for a while, which is very a
peaceful, laid-back community. partied mostly in toronto, upstate ny, and
austin. (TO rules by far!!) i've never had to deal with gang-violence.
naive, sheltered.... but narrow-minded - not a chance. anwyay, i feel like
i've been having to defend my comments on this list far too much. i haven't
'jumped to any conclusions' about what happened saturday night. all i know
is that 2 ppl were stabbed, one wound up dying. the only thing i said was
that i was in a state of shock over it, and perhaps this is due to my
naivete. i still stand behind my opinion that killing someone is not a way
to deal with a conflict. no, i don't know what they were fighting over. i
don't really care to know - i don't see how it would make a difference to
my opinion. killing people doesn't solve anything. i never said that we
were impermeable to life outside of raving; it just saddened me that this
was happening among so many people who were there soley to have a good
time, to escape all the shit that goes on in day-to-day life. saddened me
that it happened in such close proximity. nor did i say anything about 'us'
and 'them'. we are a human race, in my view; all people, all colors,
genders, religions, etc. one human race. and i still will respect the
majority of ppl for their choice in life. but i cannot, nor will i even try
to accept, understand, or respect people who kill others over a
disagreement. i don't even want to. if this makes me less of an
understanding or compassionate person, so be it. there are some things that
i refuse to tolerate. arbitrary, my ass. you know, i usually encourage ppl
to be what ever they choose, and i do respect their choices. but when
someone else's choice starts to affect un-involved ppl, they have, IMVHO,
crossed the line. and no, i can not respect murder. sorry. maybe i am
narrow-minded then.

(by the way, i did not witness this. i heard, like everyone else, and
experienced the after-effects. be careful what you say, please.)

peace, e.

 we may try to escape the horrors of
>mainstream society via the community we strive to uphold and nurture, but
>we cannot escape the world around us, and to think that we are impermeable
>to any negative forces from the outside is a little hasty.  it isn't "us"
>and "them".  it's us trying to create a community for us, a community which
>strives to absorb as many of "them" as can understand the foundation atop
>of which "us" stands.  i do not know why this person resorted to an act of
>violence, there are many other ways to reslove a conflict.  i in no way
>endorse violent behavior as a means of conflict resolution, but i would
>like to comment on how quickly we tend to jump to conclusions about someone
>else's actions, although we stand outside of the situation, and can in no
>way know all of the reasons behind why that particular action was chosen.
>once again, as i said, i am in no way trying to jump to this person's
>defense, but for a community that prides itself on understanding, it seems
>like there is an awful lot of finger pointing and alienation going on.  and
>this is one reaction which does anything but alleviate the problem of
>violence.  the more a person who engages in such activity is shunned, the
>more he will lash out.  i urge you to be careful of the things that you say
>in the heat of a very emotional moment, which i am sure this was and i am
>sorry that you had to witness it.  but at the core of harmonious
>relationships between fellow human beings is an understanding of the
>arbitrary nature of all things.....i could comment for hours on other
>things touched upon in this post, but i think this is generally the gist of
>what i am trying to say.  i hope it is understandable....
>
>my condolences to all of those touched by this travesty.
>
>love,
>lola
>

>        /M\          a         r
>       ^ V ^ i r t u a l   D e s i g n e r

From: Rhoda Rossman <rhoda@NormSki.com>
Subject: F-8 moonlit indulgence
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Got there in full daylight while there were still level spots nearby for
one's tent (a refuge - privacy - luxury).  Plenty of time to explore and
meet people!  Really good group, several hot tubs, nice warm weather (yes,
we had to bundle up after dark).  Took both kids and they loved it.  My son
even got to take part in one of my favorite raving rituals: making a friend.
I told him good job but next time get their phone #.   

Later, Ethan was excellent(despite some very ill-timed tech failureS) WITH
some of his own tracks!  Dance ground was resilient.  Groups came out and
joined in waves, repeatedly.  Moonshadows and blacklight.  The party was
excessive, but not damaging. 

Next day after more socializing, had an episode in the mud bath where
Darrell got sucked into the mire trying to rescue frogs.  He was unremovable
after my efforts.  A very muddy Candice dug us out!

Nature+music+dance = Wonderful road trip!

XO  Rhoda

night

we didn't even
start boarding till 1:00 AM. They put Doc Martin and Jeno in the smallest
room , so there 
wasn't much dance area. There wasn't much eye candy either or should I
say, none?!  The only thing positive about the evening was the vibe.
Everyone was ready to dance the night away
until shit happened. I really did not why they even turned the music back
on and tried to continue.

money they made
to the families. As far as I know they didn't(if anyone knows they did
please correct me). So I 
hope this time they take responsibility and help the families if they
need it.

From: "Greg Adair" <gregery@hotmail.com>

Subject: Wonderland review (late)
Content-Type: text/plain
Date: Mon, 23 Jun 1997 19:47:44 PDT
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Saturday night turned out to be one of the shittiest night I have had in 
a very long time...  This is NOT a flame..  I don't do that...

I heard many many good things about wonderland from the list, and word 
of mouth  (traveled all the way to sacramento, must be a very cool 
party) so I decided this would be a good party for two of my first-timer 
friends.. We trek out to SF, and after map point phone problems, we make 
it there just a few minutes after the cops did.  We hang for about 20 
mins to find out if there is going to be a party..  I decide that since 
nothing is going to change really quickly so I go to my car to get 
bubblicious(plug!!  This party is going to be legit!!  I guarantee it 
will not be broken up by the cops) fliers to hand out... I get there to 
find my car window smashed, and my backpack gone(and it had all my 
fliers in it!!! )... I was parked in a very well lit area about 2 blocks 
from the party, right next to a bar...  This sucks, "but hey, I know 
where I can find a cop!".. I go back to the party and go inside... All 
five of the cops standing just inside the door talking to each other 
were too busy "investigating" to take a report... I am pissed, its 
getting late and still no word of whats going to go on so I start the 1 
1/2 hour drive back to Sac cold as hell with no window(my sweater was in 
my backpack)... fucking sucks...
I ended up paying $400 to stand in front of a dance studio...

Which brings up another point.. I counted six cop cars in front of the 
party... If they were doing their job... oh well ..... 

Gregery

Thank you to everyone who came to my hootenanny!!  I had NO idea what to
expect, but I was really happy with the turnout.  For those of you who
didn't make it...about 10-12 people came by and we all spent a little
quality time with eachother and Mario.  A special thanks to Andy W for offering
to spin (even though it didn't work out).  I am hoping to organize something
like this again and I hope to see you all there!

WONDERLAND...
was WONDERFUL!!  All this talk about details.  Honey, I had a mega-blast!!  
Busted or not the vibe was undeniable.  No one, but no one can keep us from
partying!!  Big hugs and a pat on the back to all the people responsible.  You
did a great job.  Period.

Tight squeeze and canned cheese...

>:) Amber

E,

In your responses below you say, "Take responsibility for your actions...accept
the consequences..."  I think what Macadio was trying to say when he flamed,
er, posted back to you earlier was: The city of San Francisco does not issue
permits for the purpose of All Night Dance Parties [tm] PERIOD.  Therefore, all
SF located raves are unpermitted, so to speak.

So, to that end, anyone who goes to a party in SF should be prepared for the
fact that it might get busted and accept that they are taking that risk.

Am I wrong?

b.

Also, couldn't help but comment on this.  Earlier you said something about
taking your name off the to: field when commenting back to you _and_ sfraves...
 It's an email etiquette thing.  If you are in the to: field then this msg is
for you, to you and you are to take action [or think about it or whatever].
 The people in the cc: or bcc: fields are to take note, but not take action.
 Therefore, it is totally within etiquette and proper form to put you in the
to: field and cc: sfraves.  Not efficient always, but correct.


> At 11:32 AM 6/23/97, AndyW wrote:
> >It's tough to break even on a small permitted party, so expect to see more
> >small unpermitted parties.  Hell, if the police keep breaking up our more
> >'regular' venues, expect to see some full blown bolt cutter renegades.
>
> i find all venues fun in different ways. i like the big name djs, as well
> as the ug parties, as well as the clubs. it's just that if you're going to
> an unpermitted party, be aware of the possible bust. likewise, if you break
> the law, chin-up and take responsibility for your actions instead of
> whining about it.
>
> >I should hope the majority of us don't think parties should be about
> >liability and lawsuits but more an escape from it.  A place about being
> >real and accepting personal responsibilty for yourself, and taking what
> >you want, and dancing the way you want, and doing what you want with who
> >you want.  About getting the whole room to lift a couple inches off the
> >ground, if even for a second.  Where the only rule is that the needle stay
> >in the groove, and the only code of behavior is your own mutual respect
> >extend towards all there regardless of your hangups.  The tribe has
> >nothing to do with the law.  The tribe is an alternative to the law,
>
> absolutely. but when it comes down to it, accept the consequences.
>

I am curious,

 I heard people saying "Dance studio."  Is this the studio on Minna?
 If so. They threw Simple Pleasures there Friday night. And now that I
think about it. The promoters of that (no offence) were pretty together.
They told everyone to park way down the street at DV8 on the voice mail,
that it was a map point at 540 Howard. And they had staff hanging out
around there to point you in the right direction. Followed by more staff as
you approached that would help you back on the path if you got lost.
 I don't know really if they planned this out or anything. But what better
way to keep the cops out of the party?
 Staff see's cop, staff scrambles... Cops look for map point at 540 Howard
st..


 You know?

hai. I have to agree...the only reason violence is associated with illegal drugs is because of the fact that it is illegal.
anyone remember prohibition? all the mobsters arose to make speakeasys and stuff...
If you make a drug legal, suddenly gangs are fighting over chemlabs and supplies that are a dime a dozen and higher quality. 
They dont fight over that anymore. they move on to stuff thats still illegal.
Damn govt. :P

so i don't know how it happened, but i got to share with you all (though i have
not officially been to any raves in calif yet, because i didn't leave early
enough for wonderland and actually kinda relieved di didn't go, because i would
been going alone anyway, and prolly couldn't handle all that stress.) so i
don't know how it happened as i was saying, but i found myself sitting in front
of the stereo at 1am with my dad (gasp!) listening to my small collection of
dnb, mo wax, ninja tune, and warp stuff. he is in awe by dnb and has things to
say to everything i played him practically. so i told him about clubs and
hinted at raves, and he asked if ppl smoke weed in there (!), so i was like
'eh....you get illegal dealing stuff going on everywhere, at skool too, doesn't
mean you have to do it...'        the fact is that 'weed' in chinese has a
really bad conotation for me since i grew up with it. so i found myself almost
saying 'nah... i don't do.' that sorta stuff. but i guess i was just too
overwhlemed by my dad's welcome of the stuff i listen to. so now he wants me to
dub him yet another tape to play at work. so i chose him the mowax compilation;
hope he enjoys it tomorrow! hehehhee. we decided not to dub panacea, because
it's too dark and will drive away customers. but he digs panacea! ohmyfucking
gosh! my dad likes panacea. ok. i need to calm down............at last me and
my dad finds a common wavelength at dnb! wooo hooooo. who would guess, right?
bye! love-all. maybe see you sometime or another. can someone tell me about
phunkatech and space odyssey and audio impact (these are all 18+ places) and if
static is 18+ also. need to bring non-id friends. how are these places if i
wanna go alone.  i know no one who will go with me.........bleh.... see you
all. all these murder stuff freaks me out. be safe please. be gentle and kind
please. i don't know, but i never feel any warmth at the raves i've been too.
always a sort of coldness and detachment from others. so it could just because
i look so frightening like a monster, right?! right. have a feeling it mightbe
slightly better in calif. i guess ppl always have to uphold what their fashion
and apperance is holding them.

bye.

             <33AF78DE.392@sirius.com> 
Date: Tue, 24 Jun 97 10:26:13 -0700
From: "Niels P. Mayer" <mayer@netcom.com>
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk


>I want to thank everyone who posted on how to beat match. You have 
>turned me on to one of my current favorite ways to get high.
>
>But I have a problem. All I have at home is a dual CD player(cheapo).
>Is there a formula for beat matching, on CD's? 
>Am I just a beginner?
>Is that why Trains Wreck at Casa Hernan?

I mix on Pioneer CDJ-500mkII's w/ an Pioneer M-500 mixer. These are the
best DJ mixing decks that were available back when I purchased them in
April '96. There may be other good ones out now, such as the new high
end Vestax. Don't get anything by Denon, Gemini, Numark, GLI, etc. They
suck, IMHO.

Assuming you have (1) pitch control, (2) some way of quickly phase
aligning your tracks (e.g. a jog-dial like on the 500mkII's), (3) a
precise way of  setting cue points, and the ability to instantly start
playing back as soon as you hit and hold the cue-button or the play
button... if you have all these capabilities, you're good to go. if
not, you probably will be struggling w/ cd mixing forever.

Although you can try to beat match by "getting lucky" w/ two tracks
that are speed-matchined, you still need to "phase match", that is, get
the 1-beat's aligned. this is best done with a precision cue-up, like
they teach you in college radio broadcasting. 'cept you're doing it on
cd's (well, back when i did college radio, it was done w/ LP's only).

Best thing to do is carefully cue up by running the cd through a few
measures (i do this w/ the jog-wheel, much like you'd do by manually
rotating vinyl). Find the one. Then Set the cue point at that point
(usually, a drum hit).

when you hear the "one" on the playing track, hit and hold the cue
button, listening on the monitor headphones. as soon as the tracks
start trainwrecking, figure out which one is faster, and adjust the
non-playing track's speed. then hit and hold the cue button again on
the next "one" from the playing track. repeat speed adjustment as
needed. 

when you can play both tracks in synch for about as long as you want to
do your crossfade, hit-and-hold the cue button for a few measures to
get your timing just right (rehearse), then with the same tempo, hit
the play button, which will start your track at the cue point. then hit
the cross-fader and off you go.

Later, if you want to start getting fancy, you can start listening for
clashing bass-lines, and, for example, kill the bass (via EQ) on the
non-playing track and bump it up as you pull out the playing track.

PS: don't let the vinyl wankers start telling you that you can't
possibly beat match w/ CD's. They're all full of shit. However, you
can't beat-match well unless you have a decent CD-players. Even though
CD DJ mixers have been out for a few years, the pioneers where the
first product that didn't suck. 

=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
==      Niels Mayer -- http://www.eit.com/~mayer -- mayer@netcom.com       ==

All real positive change in this country has come through direct action:
womens right to vote, the civil rights movement, the free speech movement,
the 12 hour day, the ten hour day, the eight hour day, the end of child
labor, the right to strike, limitations on certain murderous government
foreign policies, government support for the poor.

These victories, some enormous and some small, came through much struggle
and much bloodshed, not by voting in new politicians.

Drug related:  the issue of legalizing marijuana is not in the forefront of
california politics because the politicains we elected put it there.

Rave related:  there are lessons in this for the rave community.  Cities
like San Fran are trying to outlaw our activies.  We will be helpless unless
we organize.  Organizing can help us focus on what our legal rights are, to
inform current and potential organizers how to avoid the authorities, and
can act as a springboard to spread the word on the positive and life
affirming aspects of raves which are so often ignored or distorted in the media.

Minds open, arms open, smiles wide.

Peace food and hug bombz,

Just a thought, not directed at any one in particular....
When mentioning a party on a public forum such as sfraves,
wouldn't it be good to leave out specific details such as
the exact location of the party, map point, etc...? 
There are _very_ few sites that we can throw parties at
in the city, and the last thing we need to do is advertise 
where they are.... (at least that's what i think)...

I mean, instead of saying, i went to 'Lolli-Pops & Hugzzz!!!'
at 1138 Mission St., with a map point at 227 Front St....
one could say, I went to 'Lolll-Pops & Hugzzz!!!' and had
a great time. It was somewhere in San Francisco, blah blah blah...

Am I completely out of line?

-matt (aka mc^2)
CFC

------------   ORIGINAL ATTACHMENT   --------
SENT 06-24-97 FROM SMTPGATE (mayer@netcom.com)


>I want to thank everyone who posted on how to beat match. You have
>turned me on to one of my current favorite ways to get high.
>
>But I have a problem. All I have at home is a dual CD player(cheapo).
>Is there a formula for beat matching, on CD's?
>Am I just a beginner?
>Is that why Trains Wreck at Casa Hernan?

I mix on Pioneer CDJ-500mkII's w/ an Pioneer M-500 mixer. These are the
best DJ mixing decks that were available back when I purchased them in
April '96. There may be other good ones out now, such as the new high
end Vestax. Don't get anything by Denon, Gemini, Numark, GLI, etc. They
suck, IMHO.

Assuming you have (1) pitch control, (2) some way of quickly phase
aligning your tracks (e.g. a jog-dial like on the 500mkII's), (3) a
precise way of  setting cue points, and the ability to instantly start
playing back as soon as you hit and hold the cue-button or the play
button... if you have all these capabilities, you're good to go. if
not, you probably will be struggling w/ cd mixing forever.

Although you can try to beat match by "getting lucky" w/ two tracks
that are speed-matchined, you still need to "phase match", that is, get
the 1-beat's aligned. this is best done with a precision cue-up, like
they teach you in college radio broadcasting. 'cept you're doing it on
cd's (well, back when i did college radio, it was done w/ LP's only).

Best thing to do is carefully cue up by running the cd through a few
measures (i do this w/ the jog-wheel, much like you'd do by manually
rotating vinyl). Find the one. Then Set the cue point at that point
(usually, a drum hit).

when you hear the "one" on the playing track, hit and hold the cue
button, listening on the monitor headphones. as soon as the tracks
start trainwrecking, figure out which one is faster, and adjust the
non-playing track's speed. then hit and hold the cue button again on
the next "one" from the playing track. repeat speed adjustment as
needed.

when you can play both tracks in synch for about as long as you want to
do your crossfade, hit-and-hold the cue button for a few measures to
get your timing just right (rehearse), then with the same tempo, hit
the play button, which will start your track at the cue point. then hit
the cross-fader and off you go.

Later, if you want to start getting fancy, you can start listening for
clashing bass-lines, and, for example, kill the bass (via EQ) on the
non-playing track and bump it up as you pull out the playing track.

PS: don't let the vinyl wankers start telling you that you can't
possibly beat match w/ CD's. They're all full of shit. However, you
can't beat-match well unless you have a decent CD-players. Even though
CD DJ mixers have been out for a few years, the pioneers where the
first product that didn't suck.

=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=
==      Niels Mayer -- http://www.eit.com/~mayer -- mayer@netcom.com       ==
=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=

At 2:49 PM -0700 6/23/97, Pengo wrote:
>A Kick Ass, Kick Ass, Kick ASS (Did I say Kick Ass?) Weekend!!!

Totally agree :)...

We showed up earlier, and had the best time.  There were not many people
there, and it was just so nice to be able to hang out and enjoy that
beautiful spot.

I was surprised how few people came during the day.  That place is just
beyond words, and I think if any of you have a chance to go next time, you
should see it for yourself, and enjoy it as much as possible, not just come
for the party.

I didn't know many people, but that was good in a way, because it gave me a
chance to meet some of them.  Sometimes I like going to parties where you
feel lost, and there are not too many little cliques...

The best part of the weekend - Sunday morning - people still dancing to
good music, but you are actually able to see their faces, and almost
everybody is smiling :).  That's why I love outdoor parties, those magical
mornings, when you body is so tired, but you can't stop dancing....

>Awsome, Awsome, party.
