   Wow wow wow!!!!!
That's all i can say to u all..... WOW! This weekend was one of The best 
times i've ever had raving. 
   Friday night.... Happy Kids. Got there early to set up. Hella people 
were running around trying to set up. So much positive energy!
(well.... except those two little kids.... they were kinda bugging me 
but they were cool) :0) Helped Jeremy for awhile with the ventilation 
stuff.....Jeremy, props for that,oh....except for the broken fan,that 
was a bitch! Overall....it wasn't that hot. Happy Kids was GREAT!!! 
Mystre and Mars tore it up.....Ellte and Seannie Boy!!!! AHHHH! Good and 
positive attidude the whole night! Still recovering from that.
    Saturday night.... Area 51...massive??? Ok, this party was a big one 
but not sooooo big. Yeah...sure there was alot people that weren't cool 
and bumnin and grindin in the corner but it was hella FUN!!!! TO ALL THE 
PEOPLE THAT SAW ME THAT NIGHT....... U KNOW WHY. ;0) hee hee
I hung out with such great people!!! I couldn't believe it. They 
increased my high! U KNOW WHO U ARE.  -thank u-    Dan was great but to 
bad the wires or whatever had to blow up. :0( So many other Dj's also 
tore it up but just can't recall their name..... i wonder why????
Above all the homie G's, it was a very fun night 'cause their was alot 
of UG people that showed up and was sharing their love. :0)
   Sunday afternoon.... Sunset. Ahhhhh......... a place to rest and just 
kick it. WRONG! Those damn cops showed up and had to bust up the 
party,ick!!! BUT......they moved it to Berkeley and it was much better. 
To bad i was just soooooooooooooo cracked out to do anything.... but i 
still did do my share of dancing and mingling. It was soooo much fun! I 
ran into hella people that afternoon that i kept seeing that weekend, 
they were soooo nice! 
   This weekend was just........... can't even describe it! it was way 
to amazing. :0) Got to meet soooo much wonderful....."happy kids!"
Well........that sums it up. Can't wait to see what next weekend has to 
offer. Luv ya all and thank u for making my weekend.....ALIVE!


                                       
                             Hugs to u all,
                                -mark-

PS. Oh yeah.......... PAULA AND I ARE JUST FRIENDS!!!!!!  :0)

First time this summer I made Sunset.  Almost stayed home due to fear of
traffic.  Loved the setup with the sunset behind the dj.  Why did the cops come?

Loved the new venue.  Got to carry some stuff.  Admired the crew
teamwork...after dark two people posted themselves by the records, clicking
on lighters to illuminate whenever the dj turned around.  Broke my key
bracelet, losing key, but the devine intervened and it showed up nearby
shortly after.

The dancing was super in the new locale.  Lots of fun people totally getting
down! Especially enjoyed hearing Solar rip it up.

Feeling fortunate, 

Rhoda

CheerioHN@aol.com wrote:
> The problem is all this takes money, but if a lot of people help out then
> it makes it a lot easier, also i can see how it would be quite difficult to
> fully decorate the huge wharehouse area51 was at, but a places like where the
> happy kids partys have been(im tryin not to mention location for fear of 5-0
> interfearence :o), all the smaller places would be perfect!! 

Money is ofcource, a major problem with creating a new looking themed
party. All too often banners and such are "re-cycled" to be used at
another party. And for good reason: UG Party budgets are slim. 

However...

There are many non-profit cultural groups in the bay area that help to
preserve and promote awareness of their respected culture. Whether it's
for Telugu Indian culture or Balinese or the Black Mountain Gaelic
Society, they all want to let the world know about their culture. Raves
in turn often make charitable donations to many non-profit groups.

Soo....

It's sort of a "you scratch my back I'll scratch yours" thing! We
promise to donate all or a portion of the ticket sales to the
organization and in turn they help supply us with cultural items that
would help add to the theme of a party. If the group is a cultural dance
group then perhaps they might be willing to perform!

Hopefully I will be able to someday actually follow though with this
concept. But if this inspires anyone else to do it, I say go for it!

-=Pengo=-

   Hi I'm new, as if you didn't know. I was reading through your mail and I
had a wrong impression about ravers. I always figured It was just about E.
But naw you niggas love the music. That's weird to me cause I was conviced
that me and my two best friends were the only three people in the world who
love music. I'm not a "raver" myself, I guess. I love the music and I love
to dance but I don't live the style or even talk the talk. I listen to
techno and jungle and ambient stuff but my first love is Industrial. O no
he did not say Industrial up in here. :) I just really love the bass and
drums and Industrial artists have laid down some pretty pHaT shit. I'm
currently trying to spread my horizons (musically) so if anybody has any
suggestions on some really good cd that aren't extremely hard to find could
you hook me up with the knowledge? I went to Area 51 on saturday and I
enjoyed myself. Was I the only one who got caught in traffic at 12:30 A.M
on the way to Oakland going north on 580? I was all hyped to get to the
party and I spent over an hour sitting in traffic from Pleasanton to Area
51, damn that sucked.

SKess

>First time this summer I made Sunset.  Almost stayed home due to fear of
>traffic.  Loved the setup with the sunset behind the dj.  Why did the cops
>come?

Ironically it seems there were two factions within the Richmond PD who were
at odds regarding the legality of the gathering. 1/2 the cops there were on
Pacific's side and rather angered at the overzealousness of their cohorts
in calling in a helicopter, the sheriffs, and the CHP. Long and short of it
is that approval for future Molate events will need to come from a higher
office in the Richmond PD than before.

And I'd say the days of just cruising in and throwing a party there are over...

Joe

From: "Vanessa & Miccaela " <vbaird@msn.com>
Message-Id: <UPMAIL18.199707010129340345@msn.com>
To: "Pengo" <Pengo@ten.net>
Cc: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: RE: Party Themes
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

In my _very_ humble opinion, a "fully bonified theme" would be best for UG 
events, not big parties like Area 51.  I think most people who go to massives 
are looking for good music and something cool to do on a weekend, not 
necessarily lectures or anything.  Not everyone, but a lot of folx.

But I think it'd be a great idea for UG events.  I don't know about a 
lecture--the speaker better be pretty damn good--but I could really see some 
spoken word/poetry (dealing w/ the theme), with some really good visuals, 
perhaps some ambient type music in the background.  And this should be in a 
separate room, so people who weren't really into it could have somewhere else 
to go.  But I personally think if you aren't into the whole concept, you 
should go to another party w/o a theme.

Oh, and I think it'd be easier to find cheap(er) poets, spoken word artists, 
or actors who can read out literature who would still be worth listening to 
than to find a good speaker we'd all like to listen to.  Plus it'd be good to 
support some starving artists.

Possible themes?  I dunno.  Amy's sounded good.  I think some more whimisical, 
fun themes would be fun too.  There's got to be a theme where I can wear some 
ponytails or put on some glitter and be in costume.  Like something having to 
do with Rainbow Brite (j/k)  ;-)

Oooh, how about an "Inner City Life" theme where we can all dress like thugs 
and hoochie mamas and play a lot of jungle?  (That was a joke, made by a black 
female who spent part of her childhood on welfare and living in low-income 
housing, so please don't think I'm prejudiced.  I can make these kind of 
jokes).  We can have it in Oakland . . . sorry, I couldn't resist. >:-)

All jokes aside (disregard those last 2 paragraphs), it sounds like a good 
idea if it all comes through.  Let us all know if it does (whoever puts this 
together).

xoxo--Miccaela

Message-ID: <33B864AA.895749AF@valuserve.com>
Date: Mon, 30 Jun 1997 19:00:10 -0700
From: "Ari Newman" <fubari@ValuServe.Com>
X-Mailer: Mozilla 4.0b5 [en] (WinNT; I)
MIME-Version: 1.0
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Subject: wknd review 
X-Priority: 3 (Normal)
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk

Friday nite:
its 9pm getting ready to do ?? and find a flier on my
desk...whoa....HARDFLOOR at 1015. Can't miss this! Make the calls,
coordinate with a whole bunch of ppl and jam up to the city.
So aside from the usual meat-market club crowd, drunkeness and attitude
which I hate @ 1015....that spot is still ok in my book. Insane lighting
and _usually_ wicked sound in the main room. And they do manage to bring
in world class DJs and Live PAs....
So Hardfloor's set was excellent....those guys are so good! Just knowing
that its coming out live is so cool...They were set up on the "stage" at
the end of the room opposite the decks. The sound was spot on, and they
kept jamming with the tracks..some new, some old...."Beavis at Bat"
comes on....I'm like Yeah! I've got that one!! wait....listen to that
synth...wow..phat rolling basslines...damn..don't have that remix of it.

They kept on crankin out the tracks for almost 2 hours...I was dancin
the whole time..lovin it!  Occasionally there were breaks between the
tracks, other times they were  able to keep it flowing without ever
stopping.
overall...good stuff.....worth it.
<<fast forward>>
Sat nite:
Area 51.....I had been getting psyched up for this one in a big way for
a while now....I'd never been but had heard about how insane these
parties are....so I was a wee bit disappointed by the following.
Decorations were sparse...(the space is HUGE, but nonetheless) the crowd
was overall a bit....(well, I won't even go there), and the sound was a
bit muddled. I was really expecting more of a focus on the theme....I
was all set with my huge silver firesuit and helmet. Very few other
people were dressed up....in general not many seemend really into the
Alien theme...(I was all set to get abducted and everthing =)  ) I
suppose many of the ppl there didn't even understand the significance of
the party....(it being the 50th anniversary, all the press lately, the
whole raver-alien connection, and so on.....) oh well.
I still had an absolutely great time...I can't really review the
individual DJs...or the music cause I was on an interplanetary misson
all nite....but I _do_ remember some wicked thumpin techno...good
progressive stuff that kept flowin and yet had that hardass-sorta
minimal feel to it. I was trancin' out in a big way. I did manage to
check out the DJs a few times and was disappointed to see a horde of ppl
standing around the DJ again....whats up with so many non-dancin....or
even wiggling..trainspotters,eh?
What really made it a great nite for me was, of course, the people! We
had a wicked vibe going....the space was so huge and yet it didn't feel
that way to me....(geez..I never even made it into the chill room, and
only ventured into the 2nd room once) I was   Meeting up with the SFR
crew was super....It was great to see everyone and the 2am group hug was
really intense....so much energy flowing between us.....I really felt
the power of the vibe we were creating. It was great to see SFR in the
house..... Jelo, Beth, Trice "the fuzzy top techodiva", Jenny (that was
a close one!) Gavin, Justin, Shua (did you stop dancin' once?)
Matt....(no slime next time, eh!) Macadio, Deepfog (what a suprise!)
Victoria, Christine, Amy, JoshEJosh, Nick, Ben&Iris, Ed, and wow..the
list goes on....(but my brain just quit) so Hey! to everyone I saw
there.... thanks to every one of you for making my experience so much
fun!
until we meet again......

fubari

>get outside more often to some real digs, or just stay home and leave the
>rest of us to have a good itme.  That's what I say! ;)
>
>

>>Really Works so we bring that to the next production. Ad Infinitum.
>>The only thing that gets changed(religiously thank god) is the themes.
>>

>>and 'fresh' ideas. Tonite is the CyberBus Ball, today and tomorrow is
>>The "X" games at Pier 39. All summer long are Fairs and festivals. If
>>you really cant live without Rave mussic maybe bring along a walkman. In
>>fact a walkman might be a requirement. Sorta a filter. Like on a camera.
>>"what does this picture look like with a filter?, how bout without?"

>house/rave/whatever music MORE POWER TO YA!  Now all you gotta do is start
>a party and keep it going.  Music all night and day long!  A walkman?  I
>dunno, just another means to set yourself apart from a potential group
>exeprience.  Unless of course everyone's wearing them, then it's a shared
>experience of a different nature.

>>walk into the opera. Somewhere the idea that will freshen up the rave

Received: (from majordom@localhost)
	by hyperreal.com (8.8.5/8.8.5) id XAA18824;
	Mon, 30 Jun 1997 23:01:25 -0700 (PDT)
Received: from ucscb.UCSC.EDU (thorfio@ucscb.UCSC.EDU [128.114.2.8])

Date: Mon, 30 Jun 1997 23:01:03 -0700 (PDT)
From: Matthew Alan Schwartz <thorfio@ucscb.UCSC.EDU>
Subject: Weekend Review! (long)
To: sfraves@hyperreal.com
Message-Id: <Pine.3.89.9706302248.A8733-0100000@ucscb.UCSC.EDU>
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: TEXT/PLAIN; charset=US-ASCII
Sender: sfraves-owner@hyperreal.com
Precedence: bulk


	Wow!, yet another huge rollercoaster weekend hanging out in the 
SFraves scene. All this excitment is definately starting to where me out 
*8^)!, but yet, I must say I'm having quite a memorable year, and I HAVE 
to say that within this crowd, I'm definately making the some of the best 
friends I've ever had.

Friday night - HARDFLOOR - Well, it's been a while since I've been to a 
club and I was pretty impressed. All this debate going on about clubs and 
raves kinda scared me a little but now I guess I feel that if you're with 
the right grouop of friends you can have fun ANYWHERE. Anyway, the music 
was pretty good, a little light techno for me, but the Drum and Bass 
downstairs ( or whatever that music was ) was pretty cool and definately 
got me moving. Unfortunately, I only got to see about half of HARDFLOOR's 
set ( Had to go to traffic school on saturday...DOH!, ) but what I did 
hear was really awsome, and quite unique from the music that I've heard.

Saturday - AREA 51 - After the horrible time I had at Love affair I was a 
little hesitant to go to another massive and during the begining of this 
party I thought it was going to be a repeat. The decorations were 
definately sparse, and the vibe was very wierd...kind of sparse like the 
decorations. But of course...once again the friends pulled together to 
make this another incredible night! Meeting all you SFraves was AWSOME, 
I'm sooo glad we got together and we definately should do that more 
often. The big SFraves hug shot up the vibe to the ceiling and from then 
on the party was great. Good music, ( but like fubari said...a little too 
muffled ) and in the end I guess I have to say that I'm convinced that I 
won't always have a horrible time at massives *8^) *shrug*

Ok here goes....

Hugs to the Homies...Jelo, Fubari, Beth, Nick, Ed, Macadio, Justin, Gavin
		     Jenny, Nicole,( sac town crew ) Shua, ( I take it I'm 
		     Scorpio now :P )

Madlove to the SFraves I met...AmyPaulaVictoriaChristineJoshEJoetechBen&Iris
			       AndyPAlex...And all you other awsome people 
			       of whom I have forgotten the name of. 

And to you guys who we MMMIIISSSED SOOOOOO MMUUCH...Amber, Alik, 
Byroni..etc..

YOU GUYS ARE ALL AWSOME...In fact, this whole crowd is just plain awsome 
and I can't wait to meet even more of you.

Uy vey...I need a break :)

Staaaay Cooooooool!

- Matt...the other one -

I've never actually checked out this magazine, since they started sending me Option, instead of the now defunct UHF magazine, but I got this from Mr. Postman today: Option magazine.

So I paged through the thing and found one article pertaining to female dj's.  Pretty good article, and talked about locals such as Polywog, Charlotte the Baroness, and *Stareyes*, so check it out.

It's Option's July/Aug 97, #75 issue.

article: p. 60- Female dj's- by Neva Chonin

At yer finer mega magazine newsracks!


Ciao, Mr. 2
